description:
Cookie Dough with Pretzels and Chocolate Chips are yum

***New item.. for matcha lovers!!
Matcha Verbena with Stonemill Matcha


both items in a small came out to $11

Worth a stop if you're in the area and I would say a small could be shared amongst friends who do not have a huge sweet tooth!
author: Yeanne L.

description:
Ordered a vegan fudge pop literally 2 minutes ago and it was served to me in a bowl.

Didn't think anything of it until I picked it up by the stick and realized it was all the way melted.

Ate what I could salvage without wasting too much before throwing it into the compost.

Asked the person behind the counter if they typically serve it completely melted. He acted surprised and said, "Oh, it was melted?"

Got my purchase refunded to me.

This location is a joke. Go to the Hayes Valley location.
author: Shawn B.

description:
I generally appreciate small selections as they help speed along my decision-making but the options here were almost too limited especially given that three out of the six flavors had a $1 surcharge. Unlike other ice cream shops, this one is not good for sampling. Some flavors that I wanted to try like watermelon cream were not available because no one ordered them so they were melted. That doesn't sound good. It makes me wonder if they reuse the melted stuff. 

I enjoyed the exceptionally smooth texture minus a tiny ice chip of the small Matcha Verbena I had but the flavor was mediocre. I would've liked a stronger matcha flavor. I could taste the verbena only slightly. And the ice cream left an odd sickly sweet aftertaste when finished. The only redeeming feature about this place is the bathroom. If you're in the mood for ice cream and don't need to use the toilet, you can skip this stop and get bigger portions at Salt & Straw up the street.
author: Lauren H.

description:
Am I smitten over Smitten Ice Cream?

All I'm gonna say is it's one of the better use of liquid nitrogen ice cream out there, BUT.....I still prefer Mitchell's, which is the king of ice cream in San Franciso, IMHO. 

I'm not hatin' about this place, it's actually a place I've frequented when we are in the area, and it's a good way to satisfy your sweet tooth on a hot day or a typical cold, foggy day in the city. Sure, the process of making their ice cream flash frozen in liquid nitrogen is pretty cool to watch and experience. It's similar to a magician using a puff of smoke to create an illusion.  

However, the flavors in their ice cream is lacking compared to what I'm used to. We recently came here during National Ice Cream Day, which was last month on July 15th. We decided to get the coffee flavor with toasted almonds. Even though the sauce was free that day, we opted not to get it since I wanted to taste the flavor. I got the Mountanos Family Organic Coffee flavor and I couldn't get much coffee taste. Actually, the flavor was pretty mild and not too sweet, which I liked, but there was only a hint of coffee flavor. When you advertise coffee, you better deliver. 

Again, we've had other flavors before and they were fine, but my taste buds hasn't developed quite the affinity for it. I also give props to Ruben Sue Fisher for starting her ice cream empire, which has now 4 locations in the city. She literally built this from the ground up. 

I'm not quite smitten over Smitten yet, but if I'm in the area and want an ice cream, I'd probably stop by and try their flavor of the day. 

I'd rate it a decent 3 1/2 stars.
author: John G.

description: So the menu is very limited which makes choosing a little easier for those of us that are indecisive. But why is there a surcharge for the 3 flavors that rotate? I found that very odd. I've never been to an ice cream shop where some flavors cost more. Having said that I appreciate the matcha Verbana flavor... Though it didn't taste like matcha, but the verbana was something I had never tried in an ice cream and I liked it. They only have small (2 scoops) , regular (3 scoops} and large (??? scoops) listed. But apparently you can order a kid sized one that only has one scoop.. this isn't listed on their menu. My friend didn't know that and let's just say her kids were a bit hyper after the ice cream shop trip. There is one little bench outside if you need to stay out (kid and/or dog).
author: Rou M.

description:
Two years ago it felt like everyone and their mother opened up a liquid nitrogen ice cream place but I saw a really nice photo of Smitten's ice cream taken by a friend and I thought alright I gotta do it for the 'Gram too. 

I got there at 9 pm and there were still a decent amount of people waiting to order/waiting for their ice cream. I also liked that they seemed to have a rotation of 8 flavours because I get overwhelmed when provided with lots of choices... hence my phobia of menus at Chinese restaurants. 

I picked the Mountanos Family Organic Coffee ice cream because I like pretending to be a coffee snob and I was really surprised to hear my name being called literally 30 seconds after I paid (although that sorta makes sense because they probably just had to scoop it into a cup for me...)

I spent a good minute taking the perfect picture and when I finally took my first bite... w o w what a difference from all the other ice cream I've eaten. Not too sweet, super super creamy, but not too heavy. The ice cream was miles above all the other liquid nitrogen places I've tried before (and I tried a lot because my ex insisted on trying all of them). This is the first time I felt ok with spending $5 on a scoop of ice cream. The difference was like driving a 1999 Honda Civic for years before finally upgrading to a Mercedes.

I'll definitely be back again. If perfection had a mouthfeel it would be Smitten's ice cream.
author: Calvin Z.

description: I've always been a liquid nitrogen ice cream fan and this is the best I've had in the Bay Area. Creamy and fun flavors. 3ish flavors rotate daily so don't get too attached to a flavor as it may not be back next time! It is fairly expensive if you get a cone and toppings... but I'd say it's worth it.
author: Sara S.

description:
This place had an interesting experience but the ice cream itself was underwhelming. This may have been because it was hyped up. I went on a Friday night at 9pm and there was a small line. I ordered the Cookie Dough (pretzel and chocolate chip in it) in a waffle bowl.

They started spinning the ice cream and making it to order which was cool. The ice cream was overly sweet for me but I also don't have a huge sweet tooth. The sweet and salty seemed too much with the ice cream, cookie dough, pretzel, and chocolate chips. The waffle bowl also seemed like it was sitting around for awhile as it seemed stale. That or it was too thick and didn't have the proper crisp of a waffle cone/bowl.
author: Kimberly Y.

description: So we knew we wanted ice cream, but this place takes it to another level. They only have a few flavor options, then you can add toppings for extra charge. We decided it would be better to try the sundae and then add the strawberry sauce. We ordered it with chocolate ice cream, even though I prefer vanilla. But when I asked if we could do one of each, I was told they don't do that there, because they make individual batches as they are ordered. OK, that sounds good. So we watched as they mixed and froze and mixed our ice cream. There is a glass window, so we could see the entire process and it was pretty interesting. The ice cream was creamy and delicious. It was not hard serve or anything, so it kind of oozed as it melted, but we enjoyed every bite, and the fresh waffle cone. I would recommend sharing the sundae or cup of ice cream, so you can enjoy the ice cream and not be worried about the price ($12) for a sundae.
author: Sandra V.

description:
Pretty good. I snagged the cookies dough and the earl grey. Of the two I liked the cookie dough much much more. Friendly service and the ice cream was made quickly.

The cookie dough is absolutely amazing. 

Who doesn't love Chocolate and Ice Cream? (If you're raising your hand you can stop here ) 
I like making lists what can I say. I have lists for Ramen, Steakhouse/Brazilian , Milk Tea, Egg Tarts, Chicken & Waffles (super random list right). Give my profile a follow if you like them. 

Ranking explained:  #1 (listed at the top)  is my favorite/ #?  (listed at the bottom) is my least favorite. Check out my latest reviews for my latest up to date Rankings. 

Rod's San Francisco Chocolate and Ice Cream shop Rankings: 
1 Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous
2 Marco Polo Gelato
3 Dandelion Chocolate
4 Chocolate Covered
5 Smitten Ice Cream
6 Teuscher Chocolate 
7 The Ice Cream Bar
8 Coletta Gelato
9 Cako Creamery
10 Humphry Slocombe Ice Cream
11 Bi-Rite Creamery
12 Miyako Old Fashioned Ice Cream
13 Mitchells Ice cream
14 St. Francis Fountain
15 Christopher Elbow Artisanal Chocolate
16 The Baked Bear- Custom Ice Cream Sandwiches
17 Recchiuti Confections 
18 Poco Dolce Chocolates
author: Rod M.

description: Hands down some of the best ice cream I've had in SF. Your order is churned-to-order with their liquid nitrogen machines, which makes for a super creamy cup or cone of ice cream. They usually switch out their flavors (always really original, i.e. cookies & cream with pretzel bites, earl grey tea, etc.) and allow for toppings. It's definitely expensive, but worth it if you're looking for a good atmosphere. Would recommend it as a post-date spot and/or to bring visitors, as it's pretty cool to watch them make the ice cream. Expect the place to be packed, but can guarantee you'll enjoy.
author: Ross S.

description: So liquid nitrogen freezed ice cream is a gimmick, right? I don't think it tastes any different than regular ice cream. But my bf seems to like it a lot. We got vanilla ice cream with strawberry sauce and whipped cream. It was good - the sauce tastes a little artificial to me but the ice cream is good. But $5 for a small scoop. Eek, it's definitely a treat for special occasions.
author: Alison W.

description:
A premium ice-cream joint that makes it on the spot.  The ice cream is made via liquid nitrogen right when you order it. As such, they don't offer samples for you (Boo).  There are only a few flavors available (about 6-8).

I got the cookie dough ice-cream ($5 for a single scoop).  It was pretty good; it's got lots of nuts and cookie bits in it.  $5 for a regular scoop and $7 for a double scoop.

TIPS
-No free samples
-Only a few flavors available
author: Mike T.

description:
The ice cream here has really great consistency and flavor. The best part? You get to watch your ice cream being made in front of your eyes with liquid nitrogen. The bad part? You're unable to sample any of the flavors since they're made to order. I went with the regular cookie dough, which came with 3 lovely large scoops, which was easily shared between 3 people. 

Flavors change periodically, so if I lived in SF, I'd definitely be a regular.
author: Wendy L.

description:
Tried the earl grey ice cream in a cone bowl. Creamy and delicious ice cream! I loved the bergamot flavor. 

Great ice cream means long lines, so expect to wait.

Absolutely recommend.
author: Raisa G.

description: My wife got a vanilla ice cream in a cone on this rainy day. She thought it was too sweet and the cone wasn't crisp and it was a rather steep $5.25. The poor cashier was totally stumped when she paid with a $20 bill and a quarter and tried to give her $14 in change. When my wife corrected her she had to get out her phone calculator to be sure.
author: Marco M.

description:
With so many homemade ice cream shops in SF it was hard to choose. But I am so glad we ended up here! You can't sample the ice cream because it's made to order, which is great but also scary because you don't know if you'll like what you get. I'm usually the person that has to try all the flavors before deciding so I was pretty worried. Thank god my choice did not disappoint!

ICE CREAM
Brown sugar with cinnamon shortbread paired with brown sugar caramel and tcho crispies on top (5 stars): OH HELLO! And where have you been all my life. After the first bite I knew I made the right choice of getting a regular and not a small. If you have a sweet tooth you will love this combo. I would recommend leaving out the tcho crispies though. The rice crispies just didn't taste that fresh. 

Oh, and get it in their handmade waffle bowl. The flavor on that was amazing too. 

Dough My Goodness Sundae (4 stars): Sadly this was not as good as my brown sugar heavenly concoction. I just couldn't get much of the cookie dough flavor in the ice cream. Still good, but I'd recommend the choice above! 

ATMOSPHERE
Few tables outside that are covered and some inside as well. Big enough where you don't feel cramped inside. 

SERVICE
Everyone was really nice. 

For now I'll just have to dream about you Smitten Ice Cream, until next time!
author: Latisha S.

description:
The ice cream was alright but I am completely and utterly pissed I wasted 20 damn dollars on two small fuckin small ass ice cream that they failed to tell me was only two. In the mean time while I was ordering I know the lady clearly heard me & she repeated the order back to me. The fact they didn't give me what I ordered and failed to tell me what I was spending my money on. I will not be supporting this company thats how freakin pissed I am. If I could have returned the ice cream I would have. 
Sincerely pissed off ex customer
author: Theresa H.

description:
Really good ice cream. Smooth texture and wonderful flavors. Both the cookie dough and Chocolate flavors were excellent. The mix-ins on the cookie dough (pretzel pieces and chocolate chips) were also fresh and tasty. 

Service was pretty quick and price was not too outrageous $5 for an okay serving.

Great newer location
author: David G.

description: The only reason to check out this place was because of my curiosity to look at the way their ice creams were made but the taste! nahhhh! not that great. The ice-cream is made of organic milk and other fresh ingredients so it is on the healthier side but I have eaten and experienced better ice creams. The price is nominal though. I tried Mint flavored ice-cream, special of the day, but the mint taste was so strong that I could not eat it. When I told about it to the cashier, she agreed to give me a new ice cream at free of cost. I then got their chocolate and vanilla mix which tasted okay. Overall a good place to visit once and experience the cool way they make their ice creams.
author: Devan K.

description: I can't give smitten's less then 5 stars the ice cream is smooth and creamy, and the pairing they have are good definitely complaints the ice cream and turns your reg scoop of ice cream into something different yet yummy...Also check out there sundaes as well,you can go wrong with anything you
author: jonathan h.

description: Absolutely delicious! One if the best waffle cones I'd ever had- the lemony citrus accent brought out the flavor of the waffle cone. I think the next time, i'll just order the waffle by itself; yes, it was that good!
author: Anna D.

description:
We are smitten by their ice cream. Every cup individually made while you wait with the freshest ingredients such as organic milk and cream (delivered from local farms), sugar, 60.5% TCHO chocolate, and locally grown fresh fruits and vegetables. 

The first time I tried it at this location, a beautiful setting with the simple and memorable Smitten Alley next to it. The ice cream was as fresh and delicious as ever, not overloaded with sugar and just has that wholesome flavor. 

I had the vanilla with their recommendation of strawberry sauce and the TCHO chips. It was a great combo. Just have to pace myself eating their ice cream. 

The best in the Bay.
author: Mehrnaz H.

description:
Nitrogen ice cream is one of the hottest trends in the ice cream market right now. You'd wonder if there's a difference between freshly churned ice cream and ice cream made over night. The texture and quality really does show. One of the differences I noticed was smoother and softer ice cream. Smitten makes 6 flavors a day but they rotate every now and then. You can't mix flavors or have more than one in each order whether it's a small medium or large. That's one downside of nitrogen ice cream. Courtesy of the thanx app I got an offer for a free small. I went with bee sting which really should be called bee kick! The little peppers smack you in the mouth after each bite. The earl grey could be stronger, the flavor was actually subtle for me. It tasted more like vanilla.

So am I smitten with Smitten? I guess if they get their flavors right.
author: Virginia Y.

description: I got the mint chip ice cream with TCHO chocolate sauce and TCHO crispies and I do not regret choosing this order not one bit! The ice cream was nice and creamy and a perfect combination with the chocolate drizzle and toppings. I'm not a fan of super sweet stuff so this flavor was just right for me. I also think it's really cool watching them make the ice cream with the machines. It's a good distraction watching the machine get smokey while waiting for your order. I can see why this place is really popular and I'll definitely be going back in the near future.
author: Joanne C.

description: Smitten used to be my all time favorite place to get ice cream until I became vegan. Their flavors are super fresh, and they make them right there with these super cool machines. Their ice creams are super seasonal and organic. Their ice cream tastes rich, creamy and mouthwatering. The vegan options are currently these ice cream bars called "vegan bars" and the two flavors for those are salted caramel and fudge. They're made with coconut milk, but for me, it's not worth paying 4 dollars for a small ice cream bar when I could go to a different place that has better options for me!! Still waiting for them to make vegan ice cream flavors. If you're not vegan or dairy free, I definitely recommend paying the extra money for it!! Good luck
author: Arja K.

description:
When science meets sugar and cream.... you get the coolest, smoothest ice cream ever.

At Smitten, every single scoop is made fresh for your enjoyment. You'll get to experience delicious ice cream AND a cool show, every time. 

Available in 3-4 unique flavors per day using local, seasonal ingredients.

Signature flavors:

Salted Caramel
Tcho Chocolate
Mint Chip
Cookie Dough

Only one ice cream flavor available at a time.
Look for fun toppings and sauces. 
Vegan pops available.
To go pints and delivery available.
author: Mitzi G.

description: OMG is all I can say about their Vietnamese Coffee ice cream with TCHO Chocolate Sauce... Literally tastes like a fresh cup of coffee freshly brewed. And the chocolate sauce is to die for. Together it is simply heaven!!!  Service was good, staff friendly. Not a big place at all with just a few benches to sit on, but oh so worth it.
author: Shannon B.

description:
I LOVE Smitten ice cream! There is the fun novelty of watching the ice cream getting made right in front of you, and the flavors are unique and delicious. I don't know how frequently they rotate, but if the brown sugar / ginger crumble is available when you visit I would highly recommend it! Waffle cone is always a good addition :)

Friendly staff, clean interior (not much seating inside), and plenty of outside seating to enjoy your cone on a warm sunny day.

I'll be back!
author: Chris G.

description: Fresh ingredients and made with liquid nitrogen right in front of you! Unique artisan flavors that change as the season changes, so you'll always be able to try something new! That's what really brings me back, I always like to see what new creations they've got!
author: Karen L.

description:
Creamy indeed and the ingredients taste high quality. Definitely worth your money and I'll definitely be coming back

Tried the cookie dough w chocolate chips and pretzels! It was the perfect balance of sweet and salty!
author: Rachel E.

description:
How am I going to do my sugar detox if this is on postmates HOW!?! Devoured this entire bowl moments after we got it. So this is what freshly churned ice cream is all about. My guy is the I don't give so much emotions on things kinda guy and he went sorta nuts for this like "g-- damn it" and looked so angry eating it. Thanks smitten :/ 

Mascarpone & Strawberry + Brown Sugar with Cinnamon Shortbread = H E A V E N
author: Erica R.

description: The cookie dough ice cream was delicious and everything you could ever wish for! Alicia was amazing and very helpful. Made my experience at Smitten very enjoyable! Makes me want to come back again very soon!
author: Natalia G.

description: Yummy! Came here on my visit to SF as I heard great things about the ice cream and it was definitely worth the stop! They are consistently making the ice cream, so it is as fresh as can be! The ice cream isn't anything crazy or extravagant, but just good flavors that change depending on the days and season!
author: Christine C.

description: Love the ice cream here. And since Salt and Straw popped up just a block away, the lines aren't long at all. I highly recommend the cookie dough with pretzels and chocolate chips, although the real star is the waffle cone. It's so perfectly buttery sweet and practically melts in your mouth. It is definitely overpriced - I wish they had a cone option that wasn't a waffle cone (which is $1.50 extra). But if you can get past that, it's worth it for a treat!
author: Megan B.

description:
I'm not hating on Smitten - as I know they have good reviews, but I felt there was poor service and delivery. I'm usually understanding of businesses that are busy but I really didn't understand why my order was lost. 

I ordered a small pecan pie ice cream and my order was taken by one employee and another was making the ice cream. I was prepared to wait since I read that nitrogen based ice cream is made by order, but after seeing orders after mine get served -- I  checked back in with my order, and I was told I didn't pay/wasn't on the "list".

I remember tipping and swiping my card and even checked my credit card app that indicated I paid. I was then told by one employee they would get my ice cream right out, so I waited. 

The ice cream orders for people after me continued as I sat waiting for an ice cream order that they had forgotten about. I ended up leaving without ice cream and after checking in one more time, they noted "Oh I forgot", by then I was no longer in the mood for my ice cream.. now I'm left with disputing a charge on my credit card. 

I get that places that are popular can get busy, I understand miscommunications can happen but having to wait and check with an order multiple times is tiring for a customer- when it really should be a simple/enjoyable experience. 

I'm sure the ice cream is great but I didn't feel like my order mattered in the grand scheme of things.
author: Joanne H.

description:
This is my first time at this location. They got a pretty efficient system going on now. Each nitrogen mixer is flavor specific, and they make a giant batch every so often so you will get your order faster.

The con about this place is that the ice cream is a tad pricey, however there is a loop hole. Get a pint and its cheaper, share it with a friend!

Quality of ice cream is top notch, very creamy and flavorful.
author: Elijah B.

description: Really great ice cream! They use a liquid nitrogen technology to mix it up and it tastes superb!
author: Chris P.

description: Though they have somewhat limited flavor options, the ice cream is so good! All the flavors are super smooth and creamy - great on a hot day! The toppings are definitely worth the extra $!
author: Rachel G.

description: If you haven't been to Smitten's, you are definitely missing out on a unique ice cream experience. They make every cup of ice cream fresh for each individual person that orders. I've had the chocolate, salted caramel, and the cookie dough with pretzels and chocolate chips. All three have been great, but I'd say my favorite has been the cookie dough. The sweet and salty flavors mend really well in the ice cream. It's definitely worth trying!
author: Radhika G.

description: I wanted ice cream, mind you on a cold winter day.  That's the best part.  There is about 6 flavors to choose from.  On the day we went, brown sugar ice cream was what I went with.  A single, which is $5, is 2 scoops!  I liked the ice cream but can't say much about the super sweet waffle cone....
author: Jannie Q.

description: Smitten is my favorite specialty ice cream in the Bay Area. Both times I've been (once to this location and once at Santana Row), I've gotten the specialty flavor. I've tried the normal flavors from my friends' cups but I think the extra $1 is worth with. When I came to this location, the flavor was Sweet Corn with Berries. It sounds so weird, I know, but it was delicious and seasonal. The wait can be a bit long since it's freshly churned but it's worth it. The ice cream doesn't have as much ice and over-freezing on it as regular ice cream, it isn't as overly cold (but it's still cold, don't worry!), and it's so creamy! Love it.
author: Ninette C.

description:
I always forget that Smitten has a location out on California.  I normally trek over to the Hayes Valley location but remembered that this one was here.  

If you aren't familiar with Smitten, it is such an amazing story.  You've got the owner who is an engineer that decided to use a prototype machine utilizing nitro...on a radio flyer wagon to make ice cream in the Mission.  I mean seriously?  This is what SF is all about.  

They have unique ice cream flavors with a choice of toppings.  My favorite flavor?  Their cookie dough with pretzels.  Top it with some brown sugar caramel and crispies and you've got yourself an awesome dessert.  Each cup is made individually.  Considering this, they are pretty fast.  

Definitely one of my favorite spots in SF.
author: Jen W.

description:
Heat stroke of luck. 

...guided by some unseen automaton on an uncommonly warm Labor Day, I make my way to Smitten;

1. Wait Line - good ice cream places have lines, but its Smitten's clean architectural lines that draw you in...and barely in view, way back, industrial looking stainless steel canisters build intrigue....(see pictures)

2. Quality and friendly service at the counter. - a young, engaging counter person genuinely wants my first time to mean something, and despite my visible anxiety over size options, and the foreign flavors, (bowl or waffle cone, kid, s-m-l, 4 flavors at a given time, pairing sauces); she's kind and helpful, we make a good team.

3. Meaningful Journey - Most ice cream places wear it on their sleeve - "Hey, I'm a 50's Diner", or, "31 Flavors! (minus 29 you would never order)", or "Good, but nothing you haven't seen before (Looking at you, B&J - did you die?)"; but let's face it, on a warm summer day these are all you need....or are they....

4. Enter Stage Right - Smitten Baristas scoop balls of milky goodness  the size of baby peaches from spinning tongs ensconced in a flowing ice fog (stay with me, this isn't imbued hyperbole)... then carefully, as if cradling baby chicks, they move the nitrogen cooled ice cream nuggets  into your bowl or waffle cone; sauces are then squeezed over the top according to order... and from that moment you are "Smitten": or "Smittened"; or is it Smittereened?"

4. Taste - my taste buds said this abt Tcho 60.5% Chocolate - ."OMG!", "That's amazing!", "Fo Shizzle my Nizzle!" - in other words it's crazy good; the Cookie Dough with Pretzel and Chocolate Chips and the Classic Vanilla? Ditto C.G.  I took a pint of the Chocolate home (if I had an ice chest in my wine cellar I'd keep it there, if I had a wine cellar.)

Your turn to enjoy the theatrical and patented nitrogen cooled development process and then be amazed at the organic goodness of Smitten's product  - a contrast as dramatic as "Techies in the Tenderloin"
author: Jason J.

description:
July 9, 2016 Saturday - 8:30 PM time for a treat
2 Adults and kid
 
Atmosphere - 5 stars
Food - 5 stars
Service - 5 stars 

Background - My wife found this place on Yelp to treat my daughter after a long day of playing tourist.

Atmosphere - Very modern retro look.  The machines in the shop have an old vibe to them.  A little cramp as there is not much space to sit and chill with your fresh creation. 

Food
  Treat - I went with a small and it just the right amount of a treat.  The price point is little on the high side.  The reason is that they make it right now.  Batches are going using frozen nitrogen to create the ice cream.  Gotta love science, it is like a science lab going on with all the nitrogen fog going on.  Yeah I am a nerd.  I think I enjoyed watching the process more than the ice cream.  The ice cream was great but nerd in me wanted to watch more and more.  A part time job perhaps, dang it, I live to far away. 

Service - Great.  They get your name when you pay for your treats with a credit card.  They need to call your name with a last initial.  Yeah I have a very common name, which I know.  But there were two other Paul's in the short line wait for their treats as well.

Future - Yes and perhaps one of their another location to see if they have more space.
author: Paul S.

description:
Another fantastic Smitten outpost!  We were near The Fillmore for a concert and with some time to kill after dinner but before the concert, we trekked over to Smitten.

Nice clean bright shop (same as the others I've been to).  There was quite a crowd despite the chilly night although I guess most nights are chilly in SF.

Same great ice cream.  We got a passionfruit and lychee ice cream with chocolate covered plantains which was new to us.  Super delicious like most other flavors I've had here.

Smitten's the best!
author: Brent T.

description:
I've been wanting to come here for a long time now and I finally have!! The ice cream here definitely lives up to the hype. 

My boyfriend and I had the honey thyme and blueberry lavender, each regular sized order came with 3 handsome scoops, and we finished every bit of it~ We enjoyed honey thyme slightly more as we loved the sweet flavor mixed with hint of thyme. 

Again, honey thyme - Highly recommended!

Will definitely visit again if we come across a Smitten.
author: Amy Z.

description: The ice cream is made fresh here, while you wait. It's so delicious & the recommendations for add-ons makes the ice-cream extra yummy!! The price Of course is higher than your typical ice cream shop but it's well worth it!
author: Michelle D.

description: If you can help it, don't get your Smitten cure from the one on California Street. I went there last week, no one acknowledged my presence and there were 3 people behind the counter chattering and chattering and not once did they look at the 3 people waiting to be served. I was there at least 5 minutes just to see if they would ever look over at us and they never did. To add insult to injury and I am paraphrasing since I did not take a photo, there was a jar on the counter with a sign it said something like we served you now tip us. Oh brother!!!
author: Clare H.

description:
I feel like everyone has already told you how great this place is, so I'm just gonna recommend some flavors that I love! Oh and also be advised that the entrance is a little cramped but there's plenty of room inside so don't get disheartened when there's a line out the door, it moves quickly and efficiently!


** FAVORITES **
Earl Gray with Caramel and Slivered Almonds - GET IT. So GOOD. There's little hints of I think lavender or something when you bite into it and the tea flavor is very rich! Everything here is pretty rich tbh. 

Salted Caramel - My personal favorite, you can really taste that nice hint of salt!

Blood Orange with Pistachio Cookies - You won't be able to taste the pistachio flavor too much, but the cookies add a nice touch to the blood orange somehow? They're blended in and it tastes AMAZING. (side note - I'm totally allergic to pistachio and I still took three bites of my friend's order - it was worth)


Anyway you can't really go wrong here, I took off one star because the service here is a little bit more disorganized and unattentive than the other locations some days. They're still fast, just kinda meh customer service.

The last time I went there was a line out the door and the cashier was casually checking her phone while taking orders - no bueno... but worth for that delicious ice cream~
author: Janice C.

description:
I have so many ice cream places bookmarked. Unfortunately, I don't get to check them off the list that often because I usually find myself always going back to a certain place.. in the Mission.. next to Dolores.. you know..

but not today!

The ice cream itself was good, very creamy. I enjoyed cookie dough a lot better than mint chip, which tastes straight up like mint leaves. Interesting at first but you kinda get used to it..

They ran out of waffle everything when we went. I wish they told us how long it'll take for it to be ready. We literally saw an employee walk out with a stack of waffle bowls five seconds after we paid. I'm not even exaggerating. 

Conclusion: not smitten over Smitten. Not worth going out of the way for, but I wouldn't mind trying other flavors if I'm ever in the area.
author: Laverne N.

description: The earl grey flavor is to die for, even if you're not a fan of the tea. Came by on a Saturday afternoon after lunch (no line) and was taken aback by the coolness factor of the ice cream creation process at Smitten. It's a sight to look at, and nothing about the way the ice cream tasted was compromised for the way it was created. Get those toasted almonds on that earl grey double scoop and your body should be ready for the month
author: David Y.

description: Customer service wasn't very good but the ice cream was great. We got the brown sugar one and it tastes fantastic! Wish the spoons were bigger but we will survive. The spot was clean on the inside and not to crowded. Love the seating and how the menu board looked!
author: Marley M.

description:
They don't let you get two flavors and do not l t you have any samples

Terrible customer service
author: Hannah P.

description:
Living in OC, we have our own versions of ice cream made with liquid nitrogen. My first time was here at Smitten. 

Flavors change daily, I had cookie dough with pretzels and chocolate chips. It was delicious and the texture was so creamy with the pretzel and chocolate chips evenly distributed throughout. I'm definitely a fan!
author: Lisa N.

description:
I love Smitten ice cream's rich texture. I don't love the price but it wasn't that bad since the two of us shared a regular portion. The only thing is that there are only 3 flavors at a time so if they don't appeal to you, then you're pretty much out of luck. I'm not a huge fan of holiday flavors (don't love cinnamon and candy canes) and "Chrismukkah" is what's available at this time of the year. There was another seasonal flavor that was also too Christmasy for me. I wish they would only do one seasonal flavor at a time, even during the holidays. Anyway, I braced myself for the first bite of Chrismukkah was was elated that the cinnamon/nutmeg wasn't that strong. 

My favorite flavor at Smitten is strawberry white balsamic and I would be there all the time if they had it year-round.

There isn't a lot of great seating in this shop and most people buy their ice cream to go. We were on a first date and grabbed the sole table in the back and people watched while munching on our ice cream. We had the perfect view of everything that was happening.
author: Yi Z.

description: I can here for some ice cream and this place was not what I expected. The menu has wired ice cream flavors and too small of a selection of ice cream flavors. I ordered chocolate ice cream. When I got the ice cream. It did not taste like chocolate ice cream. For some reason it tasted like it had caramel in it. Which It didn't. I won't be coming back to this ice cream shop or any of it other locations because the ice cream shop is too fancy for me. I don't like fancy ice cream.
author: Isaac H.

description: After all the trendy decor, smoky hype and pretense, the ice cream is meh.   The cone was awful --- soggy and way too sweet.  Mitchell's come to mama.
author: Hadas R.

description: I had earl grey ice cream and it really tastes earl grey!!! It was very tasty. I recommend this place.
author: Monika B.

description: Ice cream is above average but the staff are rude. No eye contact and then shouted at when the ice cream was ready. Could be much better.
author: nick w.

description:
The tingles on a body part is a good thing, right?  Their mint chocolate chip got me tingling down there....on my tongue!  What did you think I was going to say?  Get your mind out of the gutter!  ;-)

What is it about ice cream that no matter how cold it is outside, you'll still indulge in a scoop or two?  I mean, this doesn't apply to frappes or boba, but ice cream is just so special.

We were approaching Smitten and I saw a parking spot after 9PM last Tuesday.  I've heard great things about Smitten and tried a shop in Burlingame that has the same concept, but never tried Smitten.  It was a hard decision between mint chocolate chip and salted caramel, but I asked hubby, and the cashier and she highly recommended the mint if we like mint, since they use real mint loves when making it.  So we went with the mint, and then, I saw the cookie dough and pretzel one..'doh..next time!  Cool that the cashier mentioned the Smitten guarantee, in which they'll make another ice cream for you if you're not happy with your purchase.  

A small is $5 and looks like on scoop, a regular is $6 but three scoops so we opted for the regular.  We were waiting awhile for our ice cream to be made, but that's the whole deal with the made to order liquid nitrogen ice cream shops.  It wasn't green, so you know for sure they use all natural ingredients.  It was white and super smooth with the chocolate chips in there.  First bites, very minty but refreshing.  After a little bit my tongue started feeling the tingles.  The ice cream held up very well, as we were able to finish it without much melting.  

I still love Bi-Rite the most, but Smitten is a nice but kind of pricey treat every once in awhile.  I'll definitely want to try that cookie dough and pretzel flavor next time.  3.5 rounded up.
author: Cat C.

description:
Been to the tiny Smitten in Hayes, made it over to this store front the other day. 

Smitten makes solid bougie ice cream. Yes, you pay a premium for ice cream (~$5-6), but it's good, made right when you order, and they have some funky flavors. Also, I ended up being given two scoops- I don't know if by mistake or not. I just know the Hayes location normally skimps me, so kudos to the store front.

Ordered the earl grey with chocolate chips- no complaints if you're an earl grey fan. Tried the cookie dough as well- solid again. Took about 3 min wait to get both. Service was pleasant.
author: Arezou A.

description: Addicted. Seriously. I love ice cream so I come here a few times per month. I always have my favorite flavor cookie dough with caramel, sprinkles and whipped cream. The ice cream is made from a few natural ingredients and it definitely tastes that way. I would go there right now but it's 11:30pm haha.
author: Mitch C.

description:
I've had it before. It was good. 

So we went again. Was it good? We don't know. We were told you can't try any flavors and you have to buy two scoops of the same flavor. 

Drama free, we just walked the 380ft to Salt and Straw.
author: Alex W.

description: Simple neighborhood spot - and kids like watching the ice cream being made. Affordable and tasty too!
author: Nick S.

description:
Their ice cream isn't heavy and over the top which makes it a good ending to a big meal though. 

Their HCHO+Crispies=
author: Nicole A.

description: Home of the BEST vanilla ice cream I've ever had. Please take the time to read their mission statement, it will explain pricing and makes their menu items worth every penny! This place is a must if visiting.
author: Racquel T.

description: Why do you have to be so damn good?! Pretzel cookie dough ice cream... Wtf! When my wife first introduced me to smittens she said "get the pretzel cookie dough ice cream". It sounded nasty as $#! *until I took my first bite, then I went into a zone. I zoned out from the sweet vanilla and cookie dough, then the hint of salt from the pretzel hit. My God, that's some great ice cream. I want some right now. Whoever crafted this flavor is a genius. I can't wait to get back to smittens
author: Philip O.

description: No joke, amazing ice cream and fresh waffle cones. Lone lines, but definitely Worth the wait. We had just had dinner and were not looking for dessert but we walked passed this place and the smell was unbelievable. We got in line not realizing it was an ice cream parlor. It smelled like a bakery. I had strawberry tres Leche ice cream. So good!
author: Joe J.

description:
Aargh - what has this world become that people wait 10+ minutes in line to pay $7 for a cone of ice cream?! The ice cream tastes great, no lie, and the location is fun (mind the cooool patio!), but guys, seriously. I don't care if this caters the hipster crowd or anyone who doesn't mind shopping at the equally overpriced Mollie Stone's across the street. Those prices are just ridic.

#end.
author: Sebastian F.

description:
I love Smitten ice cream, see review of Octavia location. The 3-stars is for the California St. location and the fact that every time I turn up they never have any waffle cones. I haven't figured out if it's because they're waffle cone inventory management system is broken or if each time they see me coming they run and hide all their cones. Are these cones imported from China? are they sitting on the dock in Oakland waiting to be transported? no, these cones are made on premise. So if you always run out, can't you just plan to make more? Today was a classic, I was told they were out of cones "because they're so popular". Well if you know they're so popular how about you send some one out back to whip up a batch before you run out.  

Have no fear, if you are in the area and are craving an ice cream in a cone, just head up 1 block north where there is a new hand made ice cream place that has waffle cones galore.
author: Elzabeth G.

description:
Great design, delicious ice cream and a fun and hip staff. We love Smitten.  Because the ice cream is made with liquid nitrogen, it is very creamy. They have seasonal flavors that change and delicious vanilla and TCHO chocolate all the time. Today they have blood orange as they are in season with pistachio cookies mixed in to add crunch. 

All the products are from local creameries and the local chocolate maker TCHO. 
You can get their ice cream delivered on Postmates as well.
author: Nettie A.

description: I really wanted to be smitten by this place. Walked in here on a leisurely Monday afternoon and it wasn't busy. Friendly service, that is until the staff started making my ice cream. Someone just walked out of the bathroom and for some reason, the staff needed to go and turned the lock of the bathroom door... while making my ice cream! It wasn't like he needed to use the bathroom. He just went to turn the lock and then came back. The worst part is he didn't wash his hands afterwards and continued to finish making my ice cream. This is also when I noticed that none of the stuff was wearing gloves while making ice cream. I wasn't sure if I should just throw the ice cream away or say something. I won't be back for sure.
author: Michelle L.

description:
watching the ice cream being made is so fun! The place is very cute, and the workers are so friendly and generous!!! One of the workers offered us an extra scoop for having us wait for so long (which we gladly accepted hehe) 
I am confident that all of the flavors must be very good, but I personally recommend trying the chocolate mint flavor. It is nothing like the normal chocolate mint flavor you get in other basic ice cream stores - it is at least ten times more minty!!! Besides that, the ice cream here is soooooo smooth and soft!!
author: Annie L.

description:
Unique fresh and tasty ice cream. The only downside for me is the price. A small scoop of ice cream with a cone came out to $7! It's really good but that's too steep for ice cream. The service is friendly and the place is cute. There's several benches and seats to sit at inside.

I'm not a big fan of mint chocolate chip ice cream usually but the one here is amazing! The mint tastes fresh and the texture is very smooth. The waffle cone is one of the best I've ever had I could eat that alone next time.
author: Linda X.

description:
Happy they opened one closer. We are lucky to have plenty of choices when it comes to quality ice cream in the city.  My favorites are Bi-Rite, Three Twins, Humphry Slocombe, Swensen's, Mitchell's, and Joes.

Check out seasonal flavors. Hard to believe the most popular flavor is vanilla when there's so many to choose from.
author: Naty D.

description:
Yum!!! I believe to think that this Smitten location is the spot to be because one the location of where it is at, is filled with restaurants along the blocks of being located in the Fillmore. It is very unique because of the way it is set up which I have to say is very nice. Plus this attracts people to come with the way they make the ice cream and that is using nitrogen!

The ice cream that I ordered was cookie dough and that was just AMAZING with a salty and sweet bite of pretzels and some cookie dough chunks. I say that this would be the best one to order, but also the one other thing that is delicious will have to be the TCHO chocolate because you can really tell the difference from using dark and rich chocolate rather than using fake chocolate where you would purchase from the store.

I recommend for people to come and give it a try!
author: Brittany L.

description:
5 stars for the ice cream. 
1 star for the cashier with the terrible attitude. 

I love the ice cream here - great quality and delicious flavors. Today, unfortunately, the cashier (white girl with sloppy side pony tail) really left a bad impression on me. No greeting, no smile, no thank you, asked "do you have a name?" for my order. I witnessed that she was like this to everyone. I hope Smitten gets a more friendly cashier up front!
author: Ricky K.

description:
One of the most popular ice cream shops in the city, and definitely the most unique way of making ice cream that I've ever seen. 

If you haven't heard of Smitten before, they make their ice cream using a machine that the founder designed to scientifically create a "perfect ice cream every single time." And the real kicker? They make it using liquid nitrogen--so a guaranteed chill ever single time. 

They have four flavors that rotate daily due to there being four machines stocked at a time. That would be one of the downsides--there isn't the expansive selection you find at other ice cream shops in the city. And since they make the ice cream in little batches to order, it's likely that sometimes they won't have samples to try since there's no fresh batch already made yet. 

That being said, the quality of the ice cream is dope and definitely one of the top spots in the city. My favorite I've ever had was the earl grey with chocolate chips. Not too sweet, absolutely creamy, and stuffed in a waffle cup. Divine
author: Jay P.

description:
Ice cream made to order with liquid nitrogen so you have to take a risk on the flavors.  There's no sampling.  The girl who took my order was confusing.  I asked how many flavors I can get in one small.  She told me 2 and I ended up getting charged for 2 small because I wanted 2 flavors. The guy in the back told me they don't mix flavors.  

I gave it 4 because the ice cream itself is good and creamy.
author: Alice T.

description:
Don't understand the point of this place. Everything is "made to order", but it is a mystery to me why this would somehow be an advantage for ice cream. The only noticeable impact on your experience is on your wallet. And the wait time...

Maybe I just had bad luck, but when I went there, all I wanted was a waffle cone with a vanilla and a chocolate scoop. Not possible. The place was out of waffles, which l guess is fine, but l don't understand how this is possible when they make them from scratch, with same ingredients as the waffle bowl, which I was offered as an alternative. I forgot to ask, but this just strikes me as illogical.

Apart from this it is not possible to mix flavours. So no chocolate for me. Again, how is this possible when everything is made to order. The benefit should be more options, not less.

Fine , I settled for my amputated vanilla ice cream and waffle bowl. It was fine, ice cream is good, but nothing extraordinary. The staff was nice which earns them the second star.

I would still advise trying miyako ice cream down the road instead though. It's cheaper and can't be worse.
author: Martin R.

description: This ice cream was pretty good. I think this place was so hyped up that I had such high expectations. I had the Lemon Ginger Snap ice cream. It was tasty but way too sweet for me, and it only had two pieces of cookie which made the fat girl in me so sad. My dad had the Earl Grey and Chocolate Chip ice cream with the Spicy Caramel sauce. His choice was pretty damn good. The earl grey flavor was surprisingly potent, but happily so. The caramel sauce definitely made the ice cream. It wasn't spicy at all, which I totally didn't mind, but I did wish I had ordered it too. I'd come back if I was in the area, but I don't think I'll go out of my way to get here again like I had tonight.
author: Adriana G.

description:
I really like their ice cream although I'm not as adventurous when it comes to their flavor combinations. Flavors change on a monthly basis so its good to go back often. As if you needed a reason? :) 
My favorite is the vanilla with strawberry Prosecco sauce. 
The wait isn't much to order but since it's made to order, it can take a while if there are many patrons at once. Also, can't try the flavors for the same reason :( 
They have a few seats inside and out but they're close to the park if you want to walk off all that creamy goodness.
author: Amana K.

description:
I love ice cream. I love ice cream in every season. I love ice cream in a cone or cup, and with or without toppings. I would finish my last meal on earth with two scoops of old fashioned mint chocolate chip. 

This place just bummed me out. In trying to appeal to the tech enthusiasts of this city, they seem to have spent a significant amount of time and money "differentiating" with patented, liquid nitrogen fueled, single-serving ice cream machines, and in doing so, stripped away the simple magic of well-made ice cream. 

Is nothing sacred anymore? 

I came here with my husband this past weekend. It was clear we didn't "get it" when we got to the counter. We asked to try one of the more "out there" flavors (out of only 4 to choose from). Oh, you can't, because all the ice cream is "made to order". They can't do samples. 

Okay, so we settled on a scoop of vanilla and a scoop of chocolate each. Oh, you can't choose more than one flavor, because the ice cream is "made to order". Okay, fine, so we ordered one bowl of vanilla, and one bowl of chocolate each.

I suppose I could understand the small batch, made to order "thing" if it were 1) any fun to watch and 2) resulted in better ice cream. But this failed on both counts. We paid $16 for plain ice creams. You can't really see what's going on behind the counter, it's just a lot of whirring silver machinery churning out very expensive single scoops of ice cream (seriously). The ice cream itself was just okay.

There are no ingredients to be found anywhere either, so if their whole shtick with the liquid nitrogen approach is to strip out "ingredients you can't pronounce" (per their website)...they certainly aren't very transparent about what *is* being added.
author: Brittany B.

description:
Each serving of ice cream is made to order.  It was pretty cool to watch them make the ice cream...liquid nitrogen!  Yeah, they've got a patent on their system. 

Last night's flavors were: Salted Caramel, Cookie Dough Pretzels & Chocolate Chips; Nectarines & Cream; TCHO 60.5% Chocolate, Classic Vanilla  

My friend and I were both unable to decide between Nectarines & Cream and Salted Caramel.  Glad we got both, and turns out that I loved the Salted Caramel and she loved the Nectarines & Cream.

He got the Cookie Dough Pretzels & Chocolate, which he loved and I didn't like. 

Friend's husbands and two kids got the chocolate, which was very good and definitely chocolate heaven. 

Seating = limited.  There's a large bench by the window, and then one/two seaters inside (repurposed wagon), and a two-top table and 4-seater bar stool table in the back, by the ginormous liquid nitrogen tank.

Prices = moderate. $5.00 for a small.  Seems pricey. But it's pretty damn delicious. Two small scoops in a cup. Or pay for the waffle cone or bowl. ($6.00 for regular, and $11.00 for a pint.)

If you're in a rush, this is not your place.  So if you're planning to go here...plan to wait for the ice cream is made to order.  Worth the wait.
author: Fannie S.

description:
My friend was taking me home, and I commented on the long lines at Smitten.  She didn't know what that was, so I explained to her the process of how Smitten makes ice cream: ingredients quickly frozen with liquid nitrogen.  It's visually appealing while you wait for it.

She was intrigued and turned the corner to find a parking spot.  The line wasn't as long when we got there, as turnaround is pretty quick.  I ordered the strawberry white balsamic with TCHO crunchies.

It's a very interesting flavor.  The strawberry flavor was very light.  I didn't get much of the white balsamic flavor.  The TCHO crunchies were good, and I was given an extra cup since I ordered a small and the crunchies would topple over.

I like the texture of this ice cream.  It's very smooth and creamy, but not airy like gelato.  I think if the flavors were allowed to steep overnight, it would have a much stronger taste to it.  It's a little more on the pricey side, but you're also paying for the ambiance, even if you take it to go.
author: Vira P.

description:
I do not hesitate in saying that this is the best ice cream spot in SF. No contest!

We tried a seasonal flavor, the blood orange with pistachio cookies, and it was heaven!
The ice cream is made with liquid nitrogen, and the result is a creamy consistency that is mesmerizing. Little cookie pieces complemented a fruity flavored ice cream that was not overly sweet. 

It costs $5 for a small for 1, $6 for a regular to share for 2, or $11 for a pint all for myself.
author: Kevin T.

description: Happy to find this unique place. Organic ingredients. Fresh made ice cream via liquid nitrogen infusion. Fun concept and tasty results. Try it out!
author: Jeff L.

description:
On the fly ice cream making. Way different and cool. Each flavor is a custom order.
Love the consistency and texture. Smooth and creamy. 
Try the flight, 3 flavors...
Caramel had the flavor that was closer to a butterscotch, which was yummy.
Creme Fraiche is smooth and subtle. Perfect drizzle of the pear caramel. 
Mint Chip has a herbal flavor more like a basil mint. This is the most different but kudos for uniqueness.
Delightful place for a after dinner dessert.
author: David H.

description: I just bought an $8 ice cream and they are refusing to let me use the restroom. Some story about their pipes so only employees know how use the bathroom properly. I'll guess I'll go somewhere else to buy ice cream from now on. Most allow patrons to use it.
author: Patrick M.

description:
This ice cream is a MUST try. Definitely you can feel the difference between their ice cream and other competitors who have conventional ice cream. The staff is welcoming which makes your experience even better!

I wish they add more flavors like espresso :-)
author: Mohammad A.

description: Smitten ice cream is the best ice cream; it's just so creamy and fresh. Not too mention seeing them make your ice cream to order and freeze it with liquid nitrogen is a neat experience. The chocolate and seasonal lemon gingersnap and mint chocolate chip are some of the best ice cream flavors I have ever tried. I normally split a regular size with my boyfriend, because it is too much too eat by myself and much more economical that way - this works as long as you want the same flavor! I've also gotten pints from here before, but it's really more fun to eat it there or walk around Fillmore with a waffle cone.
author: Lauren A.

description:
I decided to go for something new and unusual and ordered their sweet corn with berries ice cream! First, I was disappointed in the fact that the "berries" was a thin sweet sauce put on top of the solely sweet corn ice cream instead of it being incorporated into the ice cream. I had pictured something like cookies and cream where the berries were inside the ice cream. Anyway, it wasn't that.
The flavor of the sweet corn was weird and frankly I just didn't enjoy it at all. But I'm giving this place 3 stars instead of 1 or 2 from another time I came here and got peach and it was delicious.
author: Mio W.

description:
***No samples
Got cookie dough chocolate pretzel ice cream.
Little pricey ~ $6 for 2 scoops of ice cream. Really delicious but disappointed that they don't give you samples to taste like all other ice cream places. The staffs said they make everything fresh so don't have samples but their pint size ice creams are stored in the fridge.... doesn't even make senses. They should just have a pint for samples in the fridge.
author: Gina L.

description: Best ice cream I have ever had! My favorite is classic vanilla with chocolate syrup and almonds.
author: Gloria M.

description:
Line can be long or short depending on time and day.

Ice cream is consistently good and I always grab a scoop when I'm in the neighborhood.  I'm also glad they opened this location. 

Blue Bottle Coffee is my new favorite flavor.  $5.00 for a small scoop
author: Angelica C.

description: Jason Z. Is the best worker here. He made my experience much more enjoyable. If you ever see him here, make sure to tip him. He is so cool.
author: Kirby L.

description: No line!! However, if you want a waffle cone don't come at 10:30 ): it was really cool seeing the ice cream made!! It is so good  the only thing is that there they TINY spoons like plastic sample size) otherwise it was all good and the lady helping us was very nice :)
author: Ashley L.

description:
I loved how the ice cream was made here, like a controlled science experiment! It tasted great, nice flavor combinations. Waffle bowl was superb, not too crunchy, not too soft. My vanilla-type father-in-law was a little antsy while ordering but even he found something that he liked. I had the chocolate, caramel and pretzel one, can't remember the correct name, but it was DELISH! We will be back! 

On a bad note, the music they played here was extremely loud and filthy! This could've been due to a rogue employee on duty, but regardless they need to fix it, it was very uncomfortable trying to enjoy ice cream with my in-laws while some hussy is singing about sex. And most of the other people in the shop didn't look like the type to appreciate it either. The manager needs to get ahold of that issue, IMO.
author: Heather D.

description: LOVE their ice cream. You can't go wrong with any of their flavors but the pricing hurts the wallet.
author: Karla T.

description:
Delicious!! It's expensive so I wouldn't come here often nor would I ever wait in the giant lines I often see here, but I happened to walk by tonight with zero line so I thought I would give it a try. 

The waffle cone was easily the best one I've ever had! So good you could just eat that by itself!

But then you top it with blood orange ice cream mixed with pistachio cookies?!! Yum! The ice cream is mixed to the perfect eating temperature. It's soft, but not melted, dense, and oh so yummy. 

The girls working there were also super sweet! Yum times 10!
author: Jen B.

description:
I'm positive this is the most San Francisco tech-hipster place I've ever been to. I had a root beer float, cause I wasn't really into the flavor offerings of the day, and it was good, but not $6.50 good. Fill that thing up with ice cream, not just one scoop, if you're charging that much! (Also, classic A&W is fine... I don't need an artisanal root beer...! Side note: very strong sarsasparilla flavor)

The ice cream is made in small batches all day long. Not sure why... I feel like it would be easier to keep consistency for each flavor if it was made more than one pint at a time...

Everyone working here couldn't have been older than a college graduate. It was very millennial... sorry for the stereotype! But they all looked half-confused and half- bored. There was also a girl you could see in the back eating on her lunch break. Like, don't eat in the kitchen where everyone can see you!

I dunno... worth the hype? Eh, not to me. It definitely fits a trend, though, and fits a clientele.
author: Angela H.

description: Loved that they have VEGAN pops! Tried the Salted Caramel and was really good. But the ice cream hands down was BOMB! Just had the Vanilla with strawberry prosecco! Must try this place when in SF!
author: R P.

description:
Am officially addicted ! Is there icecream rehab I can attend to? Or icecream anonymous ? 

Best flavor is the simplest one. Can't mess with simplicity . Order plain vanilla with strawberry sauce ! Trust me you won't regret it
author: cristina s.

description: This is very good ice cream, and the brrr machine does its part to make a darned creamy ice cream.  The customer service is lacking - cashier doesn't smile under any circumstance and the inflexibility on flavor mixing your different scoops is disappointing - even if you order 3 scoops they all have to be the same flavor.   Bottom line, it's good but I think SF offers better options.
author: Ashley G.

description:
Wish I could give them more stars as I hit this place up every week. This is some of the best ice cream in town, if not the country. The place is really cute and a quick pickup spot. They fresh make every single ice cream by customer using their own high tech process. This is some of the richest, most velvety ice cream with really delicious toppings.

Recommend: Salted caramel ice cream with pretzel cookie dough chunks. Amazing!
author: Brian H.

description:
I was expecting this to be another overrated SF ice cream hot spot and boy was I pleasantly surprised! the staff is super nice and while there isnt a huge variety of flavors to choose from, they are delicious. I got the cookiedough ice cream with the brown sugar caramel on top. whatever you do, GET THE BROWN SUGAR CARAMEL DRIZZLE. honestly changed me. so good. decent portion too! I was very satisfied.

UPDATE: so I didn't include that my cookie dough ice cream did not have the advertised pretzel pieces in it because at the time, I didn't care much. I mentioned it on instagram and the company said to email them and they would "make it right". I have since done so, and gotten zero response after messaging them via 3 different forms of communication. Now I care lol. Kind of frustrating that they encouraged me to take the time to contact them, but they won't do the same now. So if anyone from Smitten is reading this, hellooooo
author: Elizabeth H.

description: Terrible customer service. The blonde girl was very rude. The ice cream was good but doesn't works this bad mood. And it is not cheap ice cream.
author: Vanessa N.

description:
The first time I came to Smitten, I absolutely fell in love - I wanted to walk up all the crazy Pac Heights hills for Smitten and sacrifice all of my clean eating. I had the Crème Fraiche with Pear Caramel, the seasonal flavor, and it was totally unlike anything I had ever tried before. The ice cream itself had this wonderful, rich, creamy flavor that wasn't too sweet, so it complemented the amazingly decadent pear caramel very well. Definitely worth the extra fifty cents for the seasonal flavor... And I forgot to mention that since I'm an aesthetic eater (i.e. food must look good AND taste good), the ice cream here definitely didn't disappoint on the appearance front.

My first experience was so good that I dragged a couple of my friends with me a second time even though we were all stuffed from brunch. I told them that Smitten was too good to miss. Since we had three people, we went for the flight of three so that we could try a multitude of options. We chose the Tcho chocolate, seasonal maple brown sugar pumpkin, and cookie dough (with pretzels and chocolate chips) as our three flavors and were super anxious to try them all. Honestly, we were a little let down. My friends were really excited to see the liquid nitrogen ice cream process, but the ice cream itself tasted just like normal ice cream... nothing special. And for the flight, the servings are smaller than a normal scoop, so it didn't look as aesthetically pleasing either. They were all good ice cream flavors, just nothing as extraordinary as the crème fraiche flavor that I had on my first visit there. I was so sad that my friends weren't able to enjoy the same experience that I had my first time!

Overall, I think you're paying for the experience. Smitten is definitely on the higher side of ice cream in SF... even more expensive than Bi-Rite, Mitchell's, or Humphrey's Slocombe. For $5 you can get a small size ($5.50 for the seasonal flavor), and a flight of three, tiny scoops of ice cream is $9. I can get two large pints of ice cream in a supermarket for that price!! I would say, if you haven't had liquid nitrogen ice cream before, it's definitely worth a try. I would also recommend trying the seasonal flavors because they seem to have the highest probability of WOW-ing you. I probably won't frequent Smitten as much as I initially thought I would after this second, not-as-amazing experience. Don't get me wrong - the ice cream was still good, just not worth $5 for a small scoop!
author: Sheila D.

description: Everyone needs to experience and enjoy the decadent, churned-to-order Smitten ice cream made in a liquid nitrogen machine. The shop offers a limited selection of flavors daily but they use only the freshest, locally sourced ingredients and all flavors are simply delicious. You'll have to wait a bit since each order is made-to-order, but you won't be disappointed as it's fun to watch your ice cream being made and the ice cream itself is rich, creamy and delicious.
author: Emily C.

description:
Probably THE best ice cream made using liquid nitrogen that I've ever had. The texture of the ice creams are smooth and ultra creamy, and while they have classic flavors, they also have really unique seasonal ones as well. I ordered the creme fraiche with pear caramel and it was delicious! Super refreshing and yummy. It is a seasonal flavor in the fall though, but when autumn comes around, I will definitely order it again.

The people working here are super sweet too! When I visit the city again, I will be coming back!
author: Trisha V.

description: The worse customers service. We would like to use the restroom and they not allowed after we wait for 10 min. The detail we saw one customer used before.
author: Lica R.

description: If you're in a rush don't come here... literally the SLOWEST employees ever.  I love Smitten but choose a different location because the workers are too busy chatting to make your ice cream!
author: Sierra W.

description: Our favorite ice cream spot! Very fresh ice cream you can taste all the ingredients. Totally worth the money. It's super expensive for ice cream, but that's better than having cheap tubs of icecream in your fridge made from ingredients you cant pronounce.. We treat ourselves to a regular in a waffle cone of every new flavor that comes out since it changes every month or so (we also live above Smitten so... theres that... Great after dinner treat!
author: Felicia C.

description:
I've heard so much about this place, it was kind of disappointing when I got my ice cream! If I could rate just the interior, it'd be a 5. Unfortunately, the ice cream was just okay. I had the mint chip, which actually tasted like mint leaves in a frozen form. I appreciate that they tried to make it different than typical ice cream, but I just really like the artificial, sweet mint flavor.

P.S. There's a really cute corner outside of the shop, to the right. It's only a bench for about two people, but there's lights strung on the top and a mural on the wall. I wish I could've sat there, but it was occupied ):
author: Lauren V.

description: I love all smitten location. Now one near me. Staffs are friendly. Ice Cream is yummy and creamy. "LEMON GINGER SNAP", YUM!
author: Sandy B.

description: So there is something about American ice cream that makes it super fluffy and buttery, but well, less cold. I went for a treat and to cheer me up from this gloomy weather (rainy and cold), but the ice cream I got would melt within minutes and after the short walk home, I was left with vanilla sauce. Very yummy vanilla sauce with caramel and toasted almonds, but still. I like my ice cream a bit more solid. And cold. Like brain freeze cold. Who knew that I was going to miss that at some point? Since I experienced the same thing at a bunch of ice cream places, it may be a cultural ice cream difference, so I'm not going to hold that against Smitten Ice Cream. I like that they have a limited selection of flavors, makes the choice easy. But it's also pricey: a small scoop with two toppings was around $8. I was expecting more for that amount of money. I wanted to love Smitten Ice Cream, but was left slightly disappointed.
author: Katja S.

description: I had the salted caramel ice cream in waffle cup. The ice cream is too rich and sweet for my taste. I prefer bi-rite's salted caramel flavor. But the waffle cup tasted great. Probably won't go back again.
author: Kelvin Y.

description:
I'm absolutely smitten. This place is my new favorite ice cream place, and I always try to come here when I visit friends in the city. I've told all my coworkers that they have to try Smitten, at any of their locations. They have the creamiest ice cream I've ever had. Definitely worth the wait every time I come.

Their Tcho chocolate ice cream is to die for! And the toasted almonds are like crack.

The people who work here are super friendly. One time, the wait was maybe slightly longer than it usually is, and they gave me a cute little coupon for $2 off my next visit.

I like sitting outside in the little alleyway they have there to enjoy my ice cream with friends. It makes for a lovely day when you come here for a mid-day pick-me-up or even an after-dinner delight.
author: Eryn H.

description: So much love is put into the ice cream that you get. You may not get to try their flavors before you commit but ALL of them are just as great. Personally LOVE their Four Barrel Coffee ice cream. Smoothest liquid nitrogen churned ice cream I've had so far and just the right amount of sweetness to satisfy someone with a sweet tooth but not a fan of cloyingly sweet ice creams. The TCHO chocolate ice cream with salty caramel is also really good balance of sweet and salty for with rich, rich chocolatey flavor! I'm completely smitten.
author: Shelly M.

description:
Liquid Nitrogen Ice Cream. Pricey, but delicious and extremely creamy. Definitely worth it for the ice cream and the experience. 

They don't let you taste flavors since it's all made to order but said they will replace it if you don't like it. Small and no seating inside but there's a parklet right outside. For just $1 more you can get 3 scoops vs 2.
author: Alison B.

description:
The hype here is real folks - Smitten Ice Cream is some of the best around (dare I say comparable to bi-rite creamery?), and if you can afford it (the hype regarding the price is also very real), you absolutely need to come here and try all of the things. 

Star 1: How were the service and atmosphere?

The location is wonderful, the concept is brilliant, and the patio arrangement plays into the whole bit. If there's a downside here it's that you can't get samples, but know that's because they literally make your ice cream to order - right there in front of you! Fantastic concept. Star Granted. 

Star 2: How were the portions relative to the cost?

Alas, if you think it's too good to be true it probably is, and if there's a single downside to Smitten Ice Cream (and it is without question the only downside), it's the price, which is already well documented within these reviews. A small scoop of ice cream here at Smitten Ice Cream is $7.00. Seven dollars as in, a dollar or so short of a Chipotle burrito, double the price of a standard HALF GALLON of Blue Bell at the grocery store, and enough to get you roughly two and a half million calories at Taco Bell. Plain and simple - it's too much. Yes, I get that this is seriously wonderful ice cream, and I get that it's made in front of you, but $7.00 is simply too much for what you get. No Star Granted. 

Stars 3 and 4: How was the food?

Unf. The consistency is gelato without being gelato, and the flavor is pretty much unlike anything I've had elsewhere with respect to the density and the consistency. My salted caramel tasted as though I was actually eating spoonfuls of caramel, and that's in no way a bad thing. My cousin's mocha was equally good, and everyone else in my party was raving about their flavors. I don't know how they do it, but this is seriously some of the best ice cream you can get. Dual Stars Granted. 

Star 5: Would you eat here every day if you could?

If I could afford it? Yes - it's better than Blue Bell, and that's not something you hear often from someone who has spent any significant amount of time in Texas. Star Granted.
author: Paul V.

description: Really good ice cream and really friendly people! I ordered a small salted caramel ice cream with chocolate sauce (extra $.75/topping) and it was delicious. The small definitely felt sufficient to me. I kept eating and eating and was surprised that I still had more! I only wish they had more flavors to choose from.
author: Corinna T.

description: The ice cream is a little pricey however it is very worth it. Not only do you get to watch your ice cream being made, which is pretty cool, when you eat it, it is well worth the wait. Delicious. I wish they had one in Brentwood, hint hint :)
author: Trish B.

description:
LOVE THIS PLACE!!! Definitely a must every time I visit SF! The cookie dough with some caramel drizzle is where it's at!! My sis made me walk up a big hill as I ate my ice cream LOL! I'm somewhat a foodie with an emphasis on ice cream and this place is definitely on point!! 

Would definitely recommend!
author: Mel K.

description: I enjoyed the Tcho (dark) chocolate ice cream. Very good flavor and texture, and reasonably priced. The service was prompt and courteous. Seating is somewhat minimal.
author: Jethro B.

description:
I've heard such good things about Smitten and was really excited to finally be able to try it. I wasn't sure what flavor to get so I asked the cashier which one was her favorite and she said fresh mint chip, so I decided to give it a try. I also added the chocolate covered crispies topping. Mint chip is one of my favorite ice cream flavors so I had high expectations.

I was eager to take a bite when my ice cream finally arrived and the second I ate it, I wanted to spit it out. At first, it tasted like very fresh mint leaves (which potentially could've been a good thing), but soon after, it just tasted like I had eaten a spoonful of toothpaste.. I tried to take a few more bites but I just couldn't stomach it any more.

Sadly, I'm quite disappointed.. The best part of my first time at Smitten was watching the ice cream get made with the liquid nitrogen. If I'm ever in the area again, I'll probably give it one more try with a different flavor but until then, I don't see what the hype is about at all.
author: Melody Y.

description: Smitten has delicious ice cream and awesome sundaes. They do alcohol inspired flavors also. The whiskey chip was my favorite. Even though they are getting big and expanding they still do a great job of keeping it as a local place and homely. Definitely check it out!!
author: Makenzi B.

description: This ice cream is the best in the city. I want to divorce my wife and marry smitten. The end.
author: Matt P.

description:
Service was super rude.

Cashier girl was lifeless and rude. Told me that all the pre-packed ice cream were all packed that very day (7/3) and I told her the labels did not agree with her and even picked up one labelled 7/1 which was the latest one to purchase. The others were 6/28, 6/30. She did not deign to say anything and just rang me up. As I was paying, the ice cream maker splashed me and she actually smiled. I guess she thought it was funny. No apologies as I was wiping my arms and face.

My friend who recommended me to this place asked if she could get the rewards from my purchase. She blankly said too late. Then another friend of ours made a purchase and so she asked if she can put that purchase into her rewards. Nope, had to be same credit card. WTF! What kind of reward program is this? Bi-rite just stamped cards like anything and they do it RITE.

Definitely NOT smitten, more like frost-bitten.
author: July N.

description:
Update - just tried it again and it still sucks.  It has barely any flavor and there were pieces of ice in my ice cream.  

This is the third time I've had Smitten and I still think it's only ok.  Take cost into account and I give it 2 stars.  This most recent trip I got regular vanilla bean ice cream in a cone which set me back over $6-7???   The ice cream didn't taste bad, it just wasn't great - I could barely taste the vanilla flavor and the temperature it's served at was too cold (which sounds ridiculous but it's not haha).  I've tried other flavors as well and all were either way too sugary and/or lacked intense flavor.  Also I don't get this making it to order stuff - it seems like it's a BS gimmick cause it doesn't result in tastier ice cream, just more expensive ice cream.
author: Olivia T.

description: Tasteless, tiny portions and completely overpriced. We ordered a root beer float, and we're handed one small scoop of ice cream and a bottle of root beer. Really?
author: Nancy R.

description: I came here with my family during the Fillmore Jazz Festival. I had the Brown Sugar with Cinnamon Shortbread which was delicious. I wasn't sure about it but when I had a bite of it. OMG! I was surprised how delicious it tasted. It was the brown sugar flavor but not overpowering but tasty, and something totally different. If you ever go to Smitten, give it a try. I will also try other flavors. I wish I had Smitten Ice Cream in my area. I will remember this place and will be back when I'm in S.F. Cheers!
author: Daphne J.
