description: One of my favorite ice cream spots in the city! The atmosphere is fun and the staff is always friendly. Watching the ice cream being mixed is always a neat experience too. I can't wait for the strawberries and mascarpone flavor to be back over the summer - by far my favorite flavor to date!
author: Catherine W.

description: Tried smitten for the first time today, and it was delicious! I had the earl grey with a waffle cone. The ice cream had great flavor, and the cone was nice and fresh and crispy! Of course, this ice cream is a little on the pricey side, but if you can afford a few extra bucks, you're in for an amazing treat!
author: Rachel D.

description:
Yeah, I wouldn't know what the ice cream tastes like here, since they like to forget your order but somehow give your friend, and everyone else in the establishment, theirs.   Once I addressed this with the cashier that "everyone in here has gotten their order, including my friend" I am told that there is some issue with their iPads.   Not "oh sorry, let us try to make this for you, not, oh sorry that we screwed up, just "here we will refund you."  Needless to say, they have not refunded/credited the amount for the ice cream I never received, they never even offered to try and make it right.

Regardless of if the ice cream is good or not, I wouldn't take my business here again.  There are plenty of other places in the neighborhood to go to to get a "sugar" fix that actually appreciate your business.
author: J B.

description:
Came here after watching a movie at kabuki theatre. It was a bit after 10 pm on a sat night and there was a short line of about 8 ppl waiting at smitten. The line moved quickly. We ordered two smalls, mint chocolate chip and salted caramel, both in waffle cones. The total was around $13. Portions were pretty big but pricey for 2 mini scoops of ice cream. 

Being able to watch the ice cream ingredients being frozen with liquid nitrogen was pretty neat. 

We got our ice cream in about 5 min. It seems like each flavor is made at a different station and made to order, which seems pretty inefficient once the line gets longer. The mint chocolate chip was light and refreshing but not very flavorful. On the other hand, the salted caramel was very flavorful and a bit too sweet. My fav is still scoop in Palo Alto. The waffle cones here were a bit on the thicker side and did not taste as fresh as the ones at scoop. The overall ambiance was very cute and there was even a smitten alley for additional outdoor space to enjoy your treat.
author: Yin H.

description: Love smitten. So glad they opened another location, around a bunch of other shops and restaurants. We've tried salted caramel, TCHO chocolate (did % change over time?), or cookie dough when they had it. I liked that they had seasonal flavors, but TCHO chocolate was by far my favorite. Like the liquid nitrogen texture enhanced the chocolate flavor. After some spicy caramel was added, it tasted like dream. Would definitely end up there again.
author: Jaclyn C.

description:
We recently tried Smitten for the first time and we really enjoyed it.  We decided to go back and if it wasn't for this issue, we would have been repeat customers but we will not be going back.  

Update: I had actually written this on Wednesday and I had received an email back that day.  He said that he will notify finance.  It's now Friday and still nothing.  At this point, it's just bad business.

We made an online pickup order last Saturday at the Pac Heights location.  The online system did not email me a receipt, nothing in the spam folder, so luckily I had taken a screenshot of the order info.  When we arrived for the pickup, they did not have any knowledge of our order so they brought over their district manager.  From the conversation they were having, we were not the first with this issue.  The district manager told us that they can't give us the ice cream and we have to pay for it.  I said that my debit card was already charged, not pending.  He said that we don't have your money so I can't just give you the ice cream.  Just pay for it and if the charge is still on your statement in a few days, just call me and I will credit you back.  He gave me his biz card and we did what he asked.

In case he thought that we made an order to the wrong store, I also mentioned that when you do an online order, pickup is available for the Pac Heights location only.  It's clearly on the website but he said you can make an online pickup order at all locations.  He clearly knows what he's talking about.
 
On Monday, I checked my statement and I'm still double charged so I sent him an email with all the info on my online order.  Crickets.... 
Tuesday, I left him a voicemail requesting a callback.  Crickets... 
It's now Wednesday and I just sent him a follow up email.
 
All this hassle for $11.  Why not just give us the ice cream in the first place and say that if the charge does not go through, please enjoy and it's on us.  This has left a very bad taste and we will spend our money elsewhere.
author: danny m.

description: Everyone is right. This place has super creamy ice-cream. Since everything is made to order, you won't be able to try any flavors -- you need to be ready to either get every single thing on their menu, or be decisive on the flavor you want.
author: Kevin L.

description: I love Smitten Ice Cream! I came here on a Friday night with a friend to try some of their ice cream. I've seen many pictures of their ice cream on Instagram and had to try it myself. They had very interesting flavors on their menu like a mojito flavor and a creme fraiche with pear caramel. We both had the mojito with strawberry sauce which came out to be $5-6 each (extra $1 for the additional sauce). The mojito with strawberry sauce was delicious. Their ice cream is made with liquid nitrogen right in front of you. It's kind of interesting to see how their ice cream is made. The staff were also really upbeat and friendly which made the entire experience more enticing. The place got packed on a Friday night at around 10PM. It almost felt like you were at  a well lit bar. I would definitely come back to try more flavors!
author: Jennifer Z.

description: What else can I say but I'm smitten for Smitten. Using liquid nitrogen to make really smooth ice cream was genius. They also use really good ingredients to make some really good ice cream with some different flavor combinations (though not Humphry Sloecome different). This location is also really nicely decorated and has a nice outdoor, dog friendly (it's not very large, so probably small dog friendly) patio. It's fun to read about the design of the ice cream machine, ingredients, and the history of Smitten. The original machine was carried on a wagon and the wagon theme is shown throughout the location. The ice cream is really super smooth and tasty. You're paying for the uniqueness, so it's not cheap. $5 for two small scoops or $6 for three is a bit pricey, but given its uniqueness and quality it's worth it. I'll go every once in a while and I'll probably take people from out of town here to see it. I'll also probably take them to Humphry Sloecome to try their really unique flavors.
author: Scott L.

description: BEST ICE CREAM EVER. Came in here after eating lunch at Roam's and got the brown sugar flavored ice cream with cinnamon shortbread. It was so good!!! It had the perfect texture and was creamy and delicious just for my liking. It's on the pricier side but it's worth every penny. Definitely recommend this place
author: Cee H.

description:
This is now my favorite go-to ice cream place!! Although I wish they had a bigger variety of flavors to choose from and samples, I think it's cool how they make their ice cream on the spot. Not just that but I love the area, and it's really nice how they have an outdoor seating!! The texture of the ice cream is what really drawn me in.. 

DEFINITE FIVE STARS!!!!
author: Stacey L.

description: Our bnb was walking distance to Smitten and came here to cool out. I ordered the earl grey ice cream with tcho chocolate chips. Wow, so creamy and yummy! Definitely would order this again!
author: Mika D.

description: Yum. Stopped here after eating at Pizzeria Delfina next door (totally delicious). My husband and I shared the regular size (3 scoops) in a waffle bowl. We had the cookie dough ice cream with brown sugar caramel and TCHOs which are like little crispy chocolate pieces. It was so good. The gentlemen working the counter was great, patient while we looked over the menu, and eager to provide suggestions. He also totally knew all the lyrics to Bad Mama Jama which made it highly entertaining for me. We will definitely come back next time we're in the area.
author: Allison G.

description: I love Smitten ice cream, especially their Earl grey. During my last visit yesterday afternoon, however, their service was very lacking. The cashier, a young white woman with a ponytail, greeted us very rudely and not once did she smile or say thank you. After we finished paying she just walked away, which I guess was a signal that our transaction was complete. When they had my order they only announce it by calling out my name. Unfortunately, someone else also had my name and he took my ice cream by mistake since no one was calling out what is being given out. This happened twice and by that point I just wanted what I paid for. A better system is desperately needed. I'm not sure what had happened at the ice cream shop to make the workers so unhappy and service deteriorated so much but the only smiling face I saw that day was from a young Asian girl. This isn't the Smitten I remember.
author: Binh T.

description: I'm not sure if it was the nitrogen, the ingredients, or what - the creme fraiche with pear caramel (seasonal flavor) was delicious! So creamy and decadent. Although I couldn't really taste the pear flavor and my boyfriend couldn't stop singing the creme fraiche song from South Park, I would definitely get it again and can't wait to try other flavors. The only thing that would be nice is if you could get multiple flavors with the regular size.
author: Hoai T.

description: Earl grey is delicious! But if I'm going to spend nearly $6 for a small ice cream with 1 topping, the staff could at least be polite. They always look really unhappy when I come here.
author: Christa K.

description: Not crazy about the waffle cone as I like waffle cones to taste more like brown sugar or molasses; other than that, the ice cream is surprisingly creamy and flavorful!
author: Christina S.

description: Pretty good ice cream but is not that great. They make their ice cream with nitrogen. The cones here are the key! Fun ice cream place if you are looking for something to do.
author: Tina L.

description:
I've just had a sandwich full of Sriracha, it was hot, and there was no line.

I ordered a small Chocolate Chip Cookie with Brown Sugar Caramel sauce ("frozen"), sat in the back by the liquid nitrogen, and read the Twitters.

The window was open and there was a cold-ish breeze, I didn't mind.

I finished my ice cream, put my phone away, and left ice-cream-sated.

I gave Smitten Four Stars.
author: James G.

description: Finally got a chance to try the Earl Grey Mint Chip and omg I have found my favorite ice cream at Smitten. Though it is usually there for a short limited time, it's amazing!! Can't wait to return and have more :) customer service remains nice as well :)
author: Amanda C.

description:
Cookie dough ice cream. You must try this!! One of the best ice cream flavors I've had in the city. Been to Joe's ice cream, Ghirardelli, Swensens, Over the Moon, Cold Stone, and Mitchell's but there is seriously nothing that can beat fresh made to order ice cream. The texture and flavors are unreal! 
Yeah, it may be a bit pricey but it's definitely something to try at least once for the experience of seeing the ice cream being made in front of you. Everyone working there is super friendly which makes it even better.
Flavors that I've tried 
-Vanilla: can't go wrong with a classic, but taken up a notch with it being made from scratch 
-TCHO chocolate: if you're a chocolate lover you have to go with this one. Very creamy
-Salted caramel: they made the perfect balance of sweet caramel ice cream with not an overwhelming amount of salt 
-Fresh Mint Chip: now this one isn't your regular mint flavor ice cream you get in the ice cream aisle at target. This legit tastes like you bit into a mint leaf!! It's pretty intense. Not my cup of tea but could be yours. 
-Maple Brown Sugar Pumpkin (seasonal): definitely should try it when it's back on the menu it tastes like pumpkin pie in ice cream form!
author: Camille B.

description:
best ice cream ever! 
i loved the waffle bowl! 
i hate ice cream in general but this one was really good! 
i tried the vanilla , and the other one called earl grey ! it was awesome!!!!!! taste like black tea! lol, but it was delicious  don't forget to get the waffle bowl
author: Dina S.

description: GREAT ON THE SPOT MADE ICE CREAM.  If you looking for Rocky Road and Bubble Gum, this is not the place.  If you are looking for a well made ice-cream with limited toppings then try this place out, you will not be disappointed.
author: Greg W.

description:
Well I'm smitten. Having grown up in Ohio, I've found it can be hard to find good ice cream in California, the land of fro-yo. Smitten has done it, boys!

After a rave recommendation from an SF friend a month or two ago, self control was out the window after unintentionally stumbling upon it on a Fillmore Street wander. I had the lemon ginger snap with the suggested toppings, caramel (brown sugar caramel, maybe?) and toasted almonds - delicious! Very fresh and not overly filling like Coldstone or eating too much Ben & Jerrys. 

Stop by if you see it. It's a little expensive - $5 for one scoop plus a dollar or two more if you want toppings - but worth it if you didn't just eat a heavy meal or something. Thumbs up, Smitten!
author: Scarlett C.

description:
Gem of an ice cream spot! Fun to grab ice cream with a date. They make each ice cream to order using liquid nitrogen so it's dessert and a show that you get. 

Staff was very knowledgeable and answered all my questions about the flavors and process.

I will definitely treat myself to their cookie dough ice cream again.
author: Holly H.

description:
I like this Smitten outlet better than their original Hayes Valley one. It's got a lot more indoor and outdoor sitting space and seems to have more flavors/toppings/sauces on the menu!
Being right next to Fillmore Street which is full of my favorite restaurants in the city (such as Delfina and Dosa), it makes for a great post-dinner dessert place.
I usually go for one of the more decadent flavors such as Cookie Dough or Salted Caramel, but everyone recommends getting the Mint whenever it is available!
author: Aditya M.

description: I like the concept. Liquid Nitrogen to freeze your ice cream on the spot. Sounds like a "cool" thing. Smitten's is a local favorite, so why the low rating? Maybe it's me but everything just tasted too sweet. But it's an ice cream place, you say, so it's supposed to be sweet. I think some of the flavors are lost when things are too sweet, which then becomes a distraction. Also, the place ran out of the waffle cones. That was a bummer as well. I guess in my mind, this place is a one and done, and I can't see giving anyplace 3 stars on a place I wouldn't go back to, but there isn't a way to give 2.5 stars. Smitten's isn't going anywhere and tons of you will go and love it, but I won't be one of them. The staff is great but this place is just not for me.
author: James N.

description: I usually never order cookie dough ice cream but the cookie dough ice cream here tastes soooooooooooooo awesomely good!
author: Alice X.

description: Ice cream is fantastic! They make each batch to order and you can watch them make it while you wait! I had the Dough My Goodness and it was awesome. The whip cream was not overly sweet which complimented the dish perfectly. For anyone curious about the strawberry prosecco sauce, my girlfriend said it was "to die for".
author: Lee R.

description: We where in Japantown for dinner when we decided to give this place a try. I am very glad we did!!! This place was delicious! I ordered the hot stuff glad I did. The ice cream is made fresh for every order and you can see the process happening right in front of you. This place was a bit crowded but was fast. The ice cream is a very smooth and rich taste. I am very glad we found this place and decided to make the walk there. This a definite place to visit if you love ice cream
author: J G.

description:
This is my favorite ice cream in San Francisco, maybe my favorite anywhere. 

It's made on the moment, 100% fresh. Their creme fraiche flavor a few months was to die for. I still pine for it.
author: C. C.

description: So delicious! I got the cookie dough ice cream with pretzels and chocolate chips, topped with brown sugar caramel sauce. They make your ice cream when you order using liquid nitrogen machines. Not only do you get a wonderful treat during your visit but also an interesting display to watch which is helpful during the wait. The staff was friendly and the shop is very cute. There are a few small benches inside and outside as well as a few chairs in the front.
author: Charlotte A.

description:
At first, I thought nothing could beat the original Smitten on Octavia and boy was I wrong.

Simply put here is what this location has over the other original one:
1. More flavors. This location has 6 flavors versus 4 flavors at the original location
2. Quality.  Both locations have great quality, but this one is slightly better since it was less icy.  The original location sometimes has tiny bits of ice in the ice cream where as this one was super smooth with no ice bits!
3. Parking.  Parking is so much easier to find here.  Still street parking, but 100x easier than trying to find parking at the original one.

Note: Smitten Ice Cream is liquid nitrogen ice cream so expect slightly higher price and limited selection compared to Bi-Rite, Humphrey Slocombe, and Mitchell's. My favorite flavor at Smitten's is their salted caramel!

Also, if you've tried Creamistry back in SoCal, Smitten blows Creamistry out of the water hands down in everything from price to quality and taste.

I will keep on coming back when I'm in the city.
author: Nicole K.

description: Loved this place! Such a cute little ice cream tent. Fun to watch the nitrogen machines making the ice cream and I don't know if it's because of the fancy method but the ice cream definitely was creamy! There were so many unique flavors and sauce combos we had trouble ordering. The best was the cookie dough pretzel / chocolate chip flavor. I was also pleasantly surprised that they didn't mark up the ice cream a crazy amount. Would definitely come back if I was in SF in the area!
author: Alyssa H.

description: Fell in love with this place the first time my friend took me. TCHO dark choc ice cream is so good, creamy and luscious. So is the earl grey.
author: Siddhartha G.

description: Highly overrated. Ordered Tcho chocolate on waffle cone - underwhelmed. One of the least memorable ice creams I've ever eaten. Even the waffle cone was blah - had a strange (honey?) flavor that clashed with the chocolate. This is the 2nd time I've given Smitten a try, & I am decidedly un-smitten. Gimmicky, expensive, not worth it.
author: J. B.

description: Smitten totally gets it! I was worried at first when I saw the nitrogen machines. Sometimes a showy ice cream making process means mediocre ice cream... well, not here! My salted caramel ice cream was insane! Totally flavorful, creamy and salty. And you get two scoops for a small. I love these guys!
author: Ari R.

description:
OMG I'm so smitten by Smitten!

Swung by after having late lunch at Pizzeria Delfina next door... oh you didn't know? According to my Lyft line co-passenger, weekend calories don't count. 

Ambiance/Decor: No line to speak of?! I mean ... it was raining when I stopped by, but knowing how popular this place is, this actually threw me off a tad. 

Food: I tried the cookie dough flavor which had traces of pretzel in it. I seriously can't believe how good this ice cream was. I've tried Bi-Rite, Humphrey Slocombe, Mitchells... this tops all of them. The creaminess and perfect marriage of sweet and salty flavor was absolutely divine. I also love how they make your ice cream to order. How dope is that?!

Service: Super sweet girls working the front counter and machines. As a first timer, I was a little confused by the whole set up and the lady working the cash register suggested with zero hesitation whatsoever that I try the cookie dough pretzel flavor. It didn't sound all that appealing, but I'm so glad I listened!

Overall: Absolutely recommend! I am DEFINITELY going back. Pricey but worth it for the occasional splurge.
author: Jennifer O.

description: Kind of like going back in time, and then jumping forward into the future! The setting is old-timey and cool with neat stuff everywhere. The ice cream is made to order using an ingenious liquid nitrogen process. Probably some of the best ice cream I have ever had. Would highly recommend.
author: Latham W.

description: Pretty darn good. Tried the Cinnamon Shortbread, strawberry, mascarpone and peach and vanilla bean.  Very tasty.  If you like rich and creamy ice cream this is the place for you.  Their flavors aren't as dramatic and different as many of the boutique ice cream places such as Salt and Straw or Humphrey Slocumb but what they do have is done well.
author: Debbie L.

description: Such good ice cream. So smooth and creamy, it seemed like there was no air in it at all - but still fluffy and not dense, if that makes sense. The chocolate sundae (I forget the name on the menu) in a waffle bowl was A+++
author: Jason S.

description: Best place to go for fresh ice cream! You literally see them make it right in front of you. Perfect for hot or cold day. I went on a rainy day and it was still pretty busy! The classic vanilla is soo delicious and the mint flavored ice cream is super strong. Be aware it pretty minty! I would definitely come back for more
author: Danika P.

description: I had liquid nitrogen ice cream years ago and haven't since so coming to Smitten was a wonderful trip down memory lane. However,  Smitten took things to the next level. The salted caramel ice cream is absolutely delicious. You can taste the quality of the ingredients in the clarity of the flavor. My TCHO chocolate drizzle was heavenly, and I just had to get pretzel chocolate chip cookie dough on the side. Ideally it would've been mixed into the ice cream but that's another story. It probably took me over five minutes to decide what I wanted, but employees that day were super patient and helpful! Watching our ice cream being made was so fun, the shop has a cute outdoor seating area (be advised it's tiny) and I can't wait to go back.
author: Araba A.

description:
I am really glad Smitten has expanded! They did a great job with this location, it is really big and has a cute patio attached to it. They also have room to sell shirts and cooler bags here. It is located right next to Delfina off of Filmore, a perfect location!

Every server here was very friendly, and why wouldn't you be working in an ice cream shop! I ordered the tcho chocolate in a cone with sprinkles. My friend got cookie dough with caramel sauce. It is a fun experience to watch your ice cream being made from scratch and the wait goes by pretty quickly. The ice cream here is amazing and you can't go wrong with anything you pick! But I would skip on the sprinkles next time.
author: Alisha K.

description:
I've been to the Smitten Ice Cream in Hayes Valley and it's amazing. I was thrilled when I saw they were opening a brick-and-mortar in my neighborhood apart from the now constant temptation. 

Finally ventured in there today with some friends who were visiting. Needless to say, everything was delicious, fresh, and everything I've come to expect in a ridiculously fancy San Francisco establishment that caters to the extreme foodies we are. You don't get coffee ice cream here, you get Blue Bottle Espresso ice cream. You don't get "strawberry" jelly textured sauce, you get "strawberry prosecco sauce" made with fresh, local strawberries, and rest assured the Rainbow Sprinkles are all natural- duh. All of this means it's basically healthy and good for you, right?? Probably not but at least it's delicious and you know exactly what you're consuming. 

I noticed some people complaining about the price. If you're going to complain about pricing, you should probably just not plan on consuming any food in San Francisco outside of a footlong at Subway. Yes, this city is obnoxiously expensive but I think a scoop here comes out to roughly the same price as your Blue Bottle Iced New Orleans Coffee with Soy Milk...
author: Amanda M.

description:
Ahh this was so tasty! I got the small 5 ounce TCHO chocolate ice cream scoop and it was delicious. The ice cream is incredibly dense and even though I am nutty pants about ice cream,  I was feeling pretty full halfway through-in a good way of course.

It's not light and fluffy like gelato, but if you go in looking to satisfy your inner fat kid, the creamy organic freshness will definitely hit the spot.
author: Daffodil L.

description: The creamiest ice cream I've ever had! It's a little pricey -- $11 for a pint -- but worth every penny it you're an ice cream aficionado.
author: Tiffany I.

description: Obviously, you are going to pay a premium because of the ambiance, the creativity, and the literal "coolness" factor with its in-your-face liquid nitrogen freezing. But to be honest, the flavor I had tried, mint chocolate chip, was not as good as I had hoped it would be. The mint was too minty and the chocolate was an after thought. at least the waffle cone is worth the add on.
author: Chi Shing T.

description: Great made to order ice cream. I thought the flavor selection was interesting and delicious.. The novelty of made on order ice cream is a neat concept.
author: Jason C.

description: Helllllooooooooooo Lovaaaa....I am sooo Smitten! I couldn't just let that one go by, I don't care how many other people may have used that as their opening tag line in their Yelp review. It was a bit much ($5 for some small scoops) however the ice cream itself was delicious. I ordered the cookie dough and it was so good with little pieces of malt heaven. I also had a taste of the creamy vanilla and I will definitely be coming back for that. I LOVED the freezing with liquid nitrogen and how each ice cream scoop is made with love and made fresh. The workers are super happy and excited about their products which makes me excited too. I'm excited to come back and try every single permutation.
author: Leena B.

description: Came here for a late night dessert run and I must say the inside of this store is super unique and interesting! I got a small salted caramel and it was 5$! The first bite I took was incredible! I can't wait to come back and try their earl grey ice cream!
author: Tina C.

description:
Love you.

Bit pricy for ice cream but,

I shouldn't be eating you that often anyways
author: Whitne Y.

description:
Update: Smitten does this thing where they give gift cards to customers who have waited a considerable amount of time for their ice cream. Seems like a great customer service piece... until you haven't received your ice cream yet but the customer who ordered ice cream after you gets their ice cream before you AND a gift card. Then another 5 minutes later you finally get your ice cream but no "i'm sorry" gift card. 

Very confused about this policy.
author: Kat M.

description: Totally sold, amazing consistency and while limited, awesome favors. My salted caramel ice cream with Cayenne pepper Carmel sauce was a life experience. Please come east!
author: Rob B.

description: absolutely deeeliccciousss ice cream! cant believe i've waited so long to try this spot - though the hayes location was a bit far. we stopped by after dinner at pizzeria delfina, and got one scoop each.. i went for the salted caramel with tcho sauce and my friend the creme fraiche special flavor. OMG. both were presented so nicely, and obviously tasted so creaaaammy and smooth. such a fan!  it's quite expensive - $5.75 for one scoop and one topping, but totes worth it!
author: Christina L.

description:
Checked this place out on a whim after eating at Fresca. There was a line going out the door, but it moved pretty quick. They do the ice cream in batches so you either get yours right away or are stuck waiting until they are finished with your flavor. 

It's expensive (12.75 for two SMALL scoops of ice cream), but it tastes great! It's expensive hipster food, good for the occasional treat. I still prefer Chocolate Chair.
author: E V.

description:
I hadn't been to this neighborhood in a while, so when I saw Smitten I thought: "Hmm, don't remember THIS being here." Turns out, they'd just opened a couple days earlier.

Due to the way they make the ice cream, I was (sort of) only able to purchase one flavor -- so I went with Blue Bottle Coffee. I had it in a waffle cone. The ice cream was unbelievably smooth, and awesomely filled with coffee flavor. Plus. the waffle cone actually added to the flavor of the ice cream... gave it a crunchy, caramel-ly dimension. Definitely recommend eating it in a cone.

I did have a spoonful of my friend's TCHO chocolate, and I liked it. You could taste that it was TCHO (*if you're familiar with TCHO, that is) and like my ice cream, it was very smooth. I'd say that one would be best in a sundae, with other toppings to complement it. 

They had a few other flavors I wanted to try, but (again) due to the small (i.e. individual) batch method of making ice cream, I wasn't really able to do so. That's the one drawback -- you want to try more than one flavor, and you either can't because you can't taste it/can't wait for multiple flavors to be made for you, or you have to wait for each item in a "tasting flight" to come out.

It *is* a fun experience, though. And, all the staff were very friendly. Shop is clean and bright. And, given its proximity to Pizzeria Delfina and Sift, it's like you have a little birthday party on one block. A pricy, sophisticated adult birthday party.
author: Tami S.

description: I tried three of their ice cream flavors - mojito, nectarine and vanilla. Vanilla was the only good one. Nectarine was terrible and a bit too sour. Mojito was too minty and tasted more like a wrigley gum than ice cream.
author: Amitesh B.

description:
Just came here a couple days ago about an hour before closing. The space is lively, bright, and has a lovely outdoor seating area that must be amazing during the day. Since I came at night, I didn't expect a huge crowd, but I found that there was a line and more and more people came after I did. The service here is truly great: fast and friendly. The best part is that you can actually watch the liquid nitrogen work its magic while you wait. It's an interesting little tidbit that really adds another dimension of fun to this shop.
I got the cookie dough with pretzels and thoroughly enjoyed it. It was a bit too sweet and didn't have as much of the pretzels as I thought it would, but it was a great option. My boyfriend got the chocolate in a waffle bowl and he said it was great. I think Smitten's chocolate ice cream definitely took the cake. It was slightly bitter from the chocolate but not overly sweet. 
Overall, Smitten is a great place to get ice cream and I will definitely be back for the chocolate!
author: Marissa O.

description: First time at Smitten and the creme fraiche with pear caramal is ridiculously delicious. Caramelized pear ice cream is a flavor I haven't had in years and this hit the spot. Can't say Smitten is my number one in SF but definitely a must when in the area.
author: Margaret O.

description:
I came here during an off time - and didn't know anything about it before I went.  It's a cool concept - Made to order with liquid nitrogen - all fresh ingredients - and a cool bootstrap owner story that's worth checking out.  http://smittenicecream.com/story/#slide-346
The portions are small and on the pricey side but unique and surprisingly filling.  I do believe this is the cremiest ice cream I ever had.  I'd suggest the Mint Chocolate chip.  They use fresh mint - so it's a strong fresh flavor that has some interesting and surprisingly welcome staying power.
author: Jessica W.

description: wow- I didn't know what ice cream was until now. it's so fresh, from the texture, ingredients, and flavor.
author: Tiff J.

description: For the line and price I wouldn't come here that often. Worth a try? Sure if it's convenient but I am more of a Fentons in Oakland or bi-rite in Castro.
author: Z C.

description:
Visited:
On a Sunny October Sunday @ 3pm

The Wait:
- 10 minute 
- Menus were easy to read and well organized

Blue Bottle Espresso (4/5):
- tastes exactly like what you'd expect
- loved the texture
- avoid if you dislike coffee

Cookie Dough (4/5):
- fun sized chunks of dough + chocolate. Yum!
- was melting when I got it
- pick this if you like sweet chocolate

Other Details:
- small, neat outdoor area to enjoy the goodies (think small alley space)
- each flavor has its own station since it is made to order
- place looks really cool, no pun intended

Small = 2 mini scoops = $5 
Reg = 3 mini scoops = $6
author: David Z.

description:
Excellent, smooth ice cream, made to order.

Pleasant staff.
author: Inigo M.

description: The freshness and flavor live up to the hype. We ordered two sundaes; chocolate and sweet corn w berries. They were bothe so different, but equally delicious. The place was cute, although theres a big draft of wind that rolls through that can distract from ice cream eating.
author: Karena H.

description:
I like to leave a cash gratuity but didn't at Smitten California because the guy at the register couldn't say "hello" or "Can I help you?"---he just stared at me so that was his prompt to give my order. They were out of ice cream cones too so it was not adding up to a good time. I ordered the mint chocolate chip small size.
The mint was so overpowering that it left an odd aftertaste for a few hours---not pleasant for $5.00
author: Janet P.

description: This is an interesting concept you order your flavor they take some of this mixture and stir it around a bunch of liquid nitrogen and voilà you have ice cream. They serve four maybe six flavors with a few different toppings and the ice cream is absolutely delicious -very similar to gelato very fine ice crystals smooth and creamy and absolutely delicious we went here twice. And we were only in the area for three days!
author: Martine C.

description: I love Smitten. I consider it the best gelato/ice cream you can ever have. Yeah i wrote gelato and ice cream together. I'm Italian and I know how to use the word "gelato". And yes, Smitten is one of the most amazing gelato i ever had. Maybe it won't be your no.1 choice, but for sure you'll love it and will be inside your personal top chart. Guaranteed. Ah! And get the waffle cone. Usually the store in California St., SF, has always some of it available. The store in Los Altos, instead, it's always very very short in waffle cones/bowls.
author: Marco B.

description: Delicious, seasonal ice cream with special toppings that make the flavor just right! They use seasonal fruits and toppings- so for July they had a nectarine, a berry, and I think the traditional vanilla, chocolate, and mint. We got the nectarines and cream with brown sugar and oatmeal cookie crumbles- one scoop with toppings in a waffle cone for about $9. Unfortunately, the way they have the register set up makes it super congested even if only a few people are in the store. They need to move their flavor board so it doesn't collide with people walking up to the register- there isn't a good place to wait and figure out what you want without being in everyone's way.
author: Amy B.

description:
The good: very yummy ice cream.  I think the way they make it is sort of a gimmick, but my kid loved it.

The bad:  very chintzy on toppings -- there was a drizzle of caramel.  I want a LOT of caramel.  Still kinks in service -- they served several people before us, who were behind us in line.  A bit pricey, also.  

It's probably a four star place overall, once they get the kinks out.
author: Genevieve B.

description: Novel (and proprietary) idea, but I'm not too into soft ice cream. The toppings were good, the sauces were stingy and the waffle cones were amazing. Flavors are pretty basic with a few interesting takes. We'll check out the menu when we're nearby but won't be going out of our way.
author: Kyle C.

description: The corn ice cream!!  My ultimate fave and also seasonal.  It's been years since I've had it but can remember the taste so distinctively (one of my gfs and l stood in line twice in one visit to take advantage of our favorite seasonal flavor..but that's besides the point lol).  Also we love the waffle cones!  The quality and flavor are definitely worth every single calorie.
author: Belle P.

description: Get there early! What I love about this place is that you never know what flavors are available. There is always a unique and unexpected surprise when you get there. Strawberry and Balsamic, Whiskey Chip, Clementines and cream. They never disappoint, always incredible flavors made to order.
author: Kelly P.

description: Only got to go once, since we were vacationing in the area. My hometown has NOTHING like this! Only downside: you can't taste the ice cream before you buy, since they custom make it to order EVERY SINGLE TIME! Pretty novel concept, eh? I foolishly ordered the Bee Sting (I don't do spicy well), i figured with the honeycomb taste, the heat wouldn't be that bad. Boy was I wrong! They told me they will gladly exchange it if u don't like it, but I felt like I ordered it, so it's not their fault. It's a top selling flavor, so for people who enjoy heat, that flavor is obviously a winning combination. Otherwise, everyone else in my family liked their flavors. Friendly staff, and nice displays set up explaining the origin of the business. We would come back!
author: Maryanne L.

description: Tasty and a fun experience.. Cookie dough with pretzels is my go to. Get it regularly! Not as good as Mitchell's but better then bi-rite for sure
author: Jack O.

description: 5 stars for the best icecream I have ever had, velvety smooth and so rich. I didn't mind waiting in a line that went halfway down the block on a chilly Saturday night or the slightly steep price of 5$ for a small cup. The icecream was spectacular and the service was great. They rotate flavors frequently, my friend and I had the fresh mint chip and Tcho chocolate flavor. Both were delicious, there was actual crushed up mint in the fresh mint chip which i enjoyed a bit. I will be going back to try other flavors !
author: Vrinda T.

description: Killer vegan Valrhona fudge pops. Will the Brrrista is awesome, totally knows his flavours, and has great pairing recommendations!  He's also known for his scoops.
author: Alvin M.

description: A gimmick. Trendy for sure. But gimme a good traditional Ice cream anytime! And where's the sauce?
author: jeff s.

description: Ice cream is delicious, new joint much better than any of the old ones, but music that they play should be forbidden by the law. Techno-pop playlist straight from my sweet sixteen party.
author: Marcin T.

description: Loved it! They make the ice cream right in the spot with nitrogen. It's pretty cool. I got cookie dough and it was delicious. Service was pretty fast too.
author: Julio M A.

description: Pretzel cookie dough was amazing- it takes about 10 min for the liquid nitrogen/stirring but the wait was well worth it.
author: Erik P.

description: OMG...  That says it all.  This is the best ice cream I've had since Lapperts on Maui in 2003.  Husband had the fresh mint and I had cookie dough with brown sugar salted caramel.  Both were amazing.
author: Rebecca Z.

description: I love their ice cream here! They use nitrogen liquid so the crystals of the ice cream is smaller and made the ice cream very smooth and creamy. The best part of this place is their toppings such as the spicy caramel. It's one my favorite toppings and I Definitely would recommend. Would come back again!
author: Kelly N.

description: The Ice Cream tastes super good, but I didn't like that I had to wait for 5 minutes, because it is freshly made. I prefer the in n out ice cream stores.
author: Anna B.

description:
Stopped by here after lunch at Pizzeria Delfina. Honestly the best ice cream I've ever had. 

Tried the strawberry and white balsamic, which was so smooth and flavorful. The chocolate is my favorite here! Can't wait to try the other flavors.
author: Davis H.

description: Very nice ice cream. Cookie dough flavor is just the sweetness that I want. Made to order so you cannot have two scoops with one of each flavor. There is only one table inside but many seating places.
author: Jiayin L.

description: So I'm really disappointed with my experience here. I ordered 3 small container of ice cream to go. I was told it will take 15 to 20 mins. I come back in well over 20 mins and the employees completely forgot about me. Then the big guy at the register claimed they were almost done. As I sat and waited again, multiple customers came in, ordered, and were served before I was. They really did forget about me, and lied about it after and made me wait more! I sat there for 55mins waiting for 3 small containers of ice cream, you would've thought they were milking the cow themselves in the back alley.
author: Hamza M.

description: Ehh. I thought this place was overhyped and not that great. Yeah it's cool that it's made with liquid nitrogen and all of that, but the quality itself is not anything to rave about. It is very creamy but that is about it. Nine of us came here on a Sunday evening after eating next door at Pizzeria Delfina and there were four options to choose from. I opted for the Nectarines/Peaches and Cream (I forget which one it was) with the recommended topping on top which was the pie crust bites. I ordered the smallest size and it was plenty for me, but it didn't taste good at all. It tasted like cream cheese. My sister and aunt ordered the same thing as I did while my dad, brother, and two cousins got vanilla. The vanilla tasted much better than the flavor we ordered. I would much rather go to Bi-Rite or the Ice Cream Bar instead of this place. It wasn't worth the wait in line and frankly, it wasn't worth the price.
author: Zoe Y.

description: Truly smitten by the creamy and fresh ice cream. Do try their salted caramel flavour.
author: Niloy G.

description: Nice little ice cream shop. Good variety of flavors. I really liked the cookiedough ice cream with pretzel and chocolate chips. Ice cream is creamy and smooth,  happy i happened to be in the area and could try this ice cream shop. The neighborhood itself is a little skimpy, so i don't know when i'll be back.
author: Amanda F.

description: If you've only been to the Octavia location then you are missing out on some of the additional flavors they have at the california street location. I had the blood orange flavored ice cream with pistachio nuts and I am definitely going back just for that. Its not too sweet and the nut pieces add a delectable crunch to it. One of the best ice creams I have ever tasted!!
author: Satya G.

description: As an ice cream fanatic, this place was terrific! I got a Sundae and it definitely hit the spot. It's a fun alternative to the usual spots (Mitchell's, Bi Rite,etc.) and just as good.  However, the flavor list is quite small and the place gets very crowded. If you are looking for unusual flavors, this is not the place.
author: Molly B.

description: Came here with my daughter and what a terrible experience we had. Waited at least 15 minutes for our ice cream. Mentioned it to the employee and no apologizes at all. What is worst is that I had forgotten my sunglasses and returned back into the store to find out that the owner and employee where laughing at my situation. Very unprofessional will not be coming back.
author: Lindy W.

description: Absolutely delicious.  It was extremely fresh and the fact that it's made to order gave it even more of a delightful experience. Totally recommend this place. It's even VEGAN friendly.
author: Andrea A.

description: Very good ice cream, chocolate and salted Carmel were my favorite. The mint wasn't very sweet and the cookie dough was good but not super good. Very creamy. It's also super expensive but they make it in front of you.
author: Rebecca A.

description:
They just opened and it's a pretty good upgrade from their little stop in Hayes Valley. There are a few kinks in the system, but they're working through it. The employees at the front counter are friendly & super sweet. Some others kind of are a bit morose but can't win 'em all. :)

THIS IS MY FAVORITE ICE CREAM. My gawwwwwd- the texture. This is *ice cream* at its finest. This is NOT gelato. This is NOT yogurt. This is NOT italian ice. You cannot compare it to other stuff because it's in its own world. It's creamy as all hell and it's pretty rich/thick. I'm a big fan! It's worth a try. Not everyone likes it (lame.) but if you're into some serious ice cream and have a palate for flavor this is the jam. Nectarines & Cream is so good. The flavor is just saturated through every bite. I'm a big fan of ice creams and make my own at home, and the texture is just too good to pass.

My friend is dairy free and she goes bananas for the vegan pops!!
author: Reanne B.

description: Without a doubt, the best ice cream I have ever had!!!! I live 80+ miles away and will probably drive it just to have ice cream soon!!
author: Bob J.

description: This place was great! Not a whole lot of selection (but the flavors they did have were delicious) and a little slow (but that's because they make all the ice cream fresh with liquid nitrogen). The whipped cream was soooo good and may have ruined other whipped cream for me.
author: Nicole C.

description: In the highly competitive ice cream market, gimmick seems to go miles. In this case I was fearful that the gimmick of live mixing of fresh liquid ingredients along with liquid nitrogen was going to overshadow the quality and taste however to my surprise, I was wrong. The flavor/taste, consistency and quality of my salted caramel with cookie dough topping was truly A+. It's well worth the wait.
author: Jonny M.

description: I love Smitten and now I love it even more that it is closer to my work. This could be a dangerous combination. I could barely wait to write my review on this place. 5 stars for sure.
author: Stephanie L.

description: This is a boutique ice-cream place, you can order the flavor and watch the ice cream being made, for kids it was exciting, thrilling and fun! The place is very trendy looking, and the workers are so friendly!!
author: Iqbal N.

description: First trip here - probably our last.  The ice cream is good, but they completely forgot about our order and served well over a dozen people before us.  Don't need to wait 20+ minutes for ice cream after we've ordered it
author: Cameron W.

description: An absolutely adorable ice cream shop that perfectly blends the feeling of all natural, fresh ingredients and science to create their exotic concoctions.  I've never been a big fan of mint chocolate chip ice cream- the green color seemed fake and the chocolate was never that good.  But the mint ice cream here tasted like fresh herbs from the garden and the TCHO chocolate chips and chocolate sauce complemented it perfectly.  Add liquid nitrogen and it's fun to watch being made and to eat!
author: Jacqueline Y.

description: $5 for a small scoop of ice cream. Yeah it's creamy but it's not like it's extraordinary.  Plus the fact that they only have six favors to choose from is not extensive.  I hate the fact that the regular size gives you three small scoops and they won't let you mix flavors.  Next ice cream shop please.
author: K M.

description: Excellent flavor and creativity. Strawberry white balsamic! They also have guarantee that you'll like it or you can get a different flavor.
author: Sam S.

description: Creamiest ice cream on the planet. Fresh, organic ingredients and small batches make this liquid nitrogen ice cream shop a destination to indulge in daily. Try the brown sugar caramel and seasonal nectarines and cream flavor. Amazing. Smitten will be the reason the liquid nitrogen ice cream fad lasts.
author: Katie A.

description: Probably the best ice cream available in SF. Go big and order one of their sundaes. Epic!
author: 1 D.

description:
About the wait: The line was out the door, which prompted some in my group to encourage us to go elsewhere. But I've been curious to try this new ice cream shop for awhile, so I wasn't going to budge. The line wasn't too bad- less than 10 minutes in line, plus a 10 minute wait, on par with Loving Cup on a busy night. 

About the service: Benadict was super patient as we all placed our orders. Seems like the employees were all busy, but happy to work there.

About the place: It is fairly small, but you can find a place to wait and have your ice cream inside. Otherwise, it's location at Fillmore and California allows you to go for a nice stroll with your dessert.

About the ice cream: The wait here was so worth it! The flavors were amazing, the waffle cones were the best I've ever had. No dessert guilt here- they use fresh ingredients and I didn't feel gross afterward, like, "Blah- why did I just eat that?!" In fact, I've already picked out what I want to order next time. They change the flavors regularly, based on what is in season, so I think I'll be back very, very soon as all of the choices tonight sounded amazing. Great job, Smitten - you have a new loyal customer!
author: J K.

description: Not a huge fan of vanilla ice cream but it was so yummy! They did run out of the cookie dough which was a bummer, but it was still good. The best part is that it's organic! Will definitely be back!
author: Oksana E.

description: Wonderful little ice cream shop.  Their blood orange ice cream is simply the best - it was a limited time flavor when I tried it, so hope they keep it around for others to try!
author: Josh Q.

description: Recently opened at this location. On opening night, got blue bottle espresso ice cream with TCHO chocolate on top. Super rich and creamy. Highly recommend!
author: Sarah V.

description:
Overall, I'm a big fan of Smitten. 

Delicious. The whole nitrogen thing makes a really smooth ice cream. You can tell it is made with fresh ingredients. And the cones are fantastic. It's not cheap, but in comparison to other places in SF, it's not overpriced either.

Smitten also has  fun vibe going on and is very clean. The one in Pacific Heights has a nice little outdoor area, as well.

Today when I went, they were definitely having some service issues and they ended up messing up my order a few times. You could tell they were sincerely sorry and I appreciated how the staff went out of their way to correct everything. However, when my friends and I walked into the little outdoor patio area to eat our ice cream, a woman was painting a side of it and rudely told us that she "needed to work..." and that we needed to get out of the way. After waiting 30 minutes for ice cream, I was a little mad about being shooed out.
author: Lynn A.

description: Really disappointing!!  I walked him this afternoon really excited for some delicious ice cream.  Sadly, thanks to shockingly bad customer service I just walked out a frustrated customer.  At five dollars for a small serving you think they would try to show some "appreciation" for their customers.  It probably took 10 min. for my ice cream - and not because they were making it or there was anyone in front of me.  Two of the "baristas ", as they call them, were happily chatting with each other.  The guy at the counter was spending more time chatting up a girl he found attractive than taking people's orders.  A couple of us stood there for 5 min. - with not one bit of activity relating to making our ice cream, no nitrogen being injected into the mixers, no mixers spinning, no one pouring anything in the mixers.  They were all too busy not doing their jobs to make some ice cream.  Bring on the robot ice cream makers!!
author: David M.

description: I happened across this ice cream spot on a recent trip to SF. The foodie snob that I am, I needed to check it out. Ice cream is made right in front of you with ingredients that you can pronounce. It's the craft beer of ice cream! So delicious and creamy and not too sweet. Check it out!
author: Robin C.

description: A ridiculous, expensive gimmick with too many "rules."  First, my ice cream came out of large mixing container that had been made some time ago.  They don't "make" your actual ice cream while you are waiting.  Second, you can't have toppings on a cone.  Why?  You wait at least 10 minutes for the inefficient staff to scoop your ice cream.  Our server was trying to use a flimsy plastic cup to hold a waffle cone while he tried to add a second scoop.  Ever heard of cone holders?  Smitten people, try checking out a Baskin Robbins.  The ice cream... OK but not worth the wait or the price.
author: Bill S.

description: So I hate chocolate ice cream but the the girl working the register recommended it and I decided to follow her advice. The ice cream, service and overall experience was A-1.
author: That Dad Life -.

description: The ice cream here is SOOO delicious! Pricey, but worth it :). Yum!!!
author: Steph L.

description: liquid nitrogen cold temperature = the smoothest, richest ice cream ever.  simply, the best chocolate ice cream in my life, and I doubt I will run into something better.  try it, you'll probably agree with me.
author: Akir M.

description: One off my check list. The ice cream texture is very smooth. I really like the Strawberry white balsamic flavor. Overall experience is good, but I thought it's a bit  too creamy for me, and the waffle cone is too buttery.
author: Michelle N.

description: Ice cream was aight, but bit so hard into a pistachio shell I practically cracked my tooth in half.  1 star for not covering the basics.
author: Click C.

description: YUM! Get the mint choc chip. So unbelievably good and actually tastes like real mint. Only downside is that they change their flavors constantly and came here the other day craving it and they weren't serving this flavor. Also, for the people complaining about the price - yes it's expensive for an ice cream cone but you're paying for a fresh batch of literally made to order ice cream. If you're looking for a deal then go buy a cheapo pint across the street at Mollie Stones. This place lives up to the hype.
author: Alexis T.

description: Fantastic.   I am not typically "Smitten" with gimmicks, however very good.   The mint is very authentic and fresh.  Wait staff very nice.
author: K C.

description: Ridiculously overpriced, takes a really long time, and you don't get much for your money. The chocolate and salted caramel are good. The strawberry white balsamic tastes like tangy frozen yogurt and I did not like it. The mint chip tastes like water that has a fresh mint leaf in it and has some how been made into ice cream - very watered down mint flavor and can't really taste the chocolate chips either. The waffle cones are good. Except for the chocolate and salted caramel, I wouldn't really call the texture creamy. More like airy. Overall, not my favorite ice cream but it's the only ice cream in this hood.
author: Holly M.

description: AMAZING choices and the freshness is very nice! Expect to wait in line for a period of time, but when you get it, it's worth it!
author: E S.

description: Great ice cream, very creamy and  smooth. It was very cool to watch them make it with the liquid nitrogen. We had the cookie dough and the tcho chocolate, both were awesome. Overall good device and just a cool place!
author: Annie P.
